<u>The Slug  </u>
Cost: 15 SP  
Your power allows you to edit brains through touch. You can brainwash individuals, erase memories, and implant knowledge of languages you know into individuals. You’re able to remove powers as you can choose to edit the brain of an affected individual so that a spoken key word or phrase will permanently take away their connection to their powers, i.e., the individual loses their powers for good. You can also set a spoken key word or phrase that temporarily removes that individual's powers. Though this can be taxing if overused.

Teacher  
Cost: 11 SP  
You have a master/trump power that grants thinker/tinker powers to people you choose, however the stronger the power the greater decrease in faculties in the subject, making them unable to express any information/skills from their abilities. You can also modify existing powers to a limited degree, by using a sort of hypnotic state to unlock it, similar to a second trigger.

Sere  
Cost: 12 SP  
You have the ability to violently draw in moisture from your environment, allowing you to stun or kill your targets. This ability ignores force fields and armor. This limited hydrokinesis, which is conversely not Manton-limited, is effectively targeted dehydration. You can use your power in a long tight cone-shaped "blast" or in a tight field around you. The moisture you extract remains floating around you.

Scrub  
Cost: 13 SP  
Your power constantly generates beach ball-sized spheres of energy in your immediate vicinity that manifest as flashes of white light. Your shard finds a parallel Earth with roughly corresponding architecture and swaps more permanent elements of this architecture in as needed, while shunting any remaining matter caught in these blasts out to that parallel Earth. Thus, your spherical explosions appear to delete matter but typically leave the ground and buildings intact because they are effectively portal cuts that also swap select elements in to avoid tearing up your own footing, as such your power never blasts the ground out from under your feet.  
Your spheres of energy are All-or-Nothing, their shunting/swapping of matter cannot be blocked by any non-perfect defense. Including the Endbringers. You can push your power into overdrive to generate explosions more frequently. As your power is heavily interdimensional, your power is always on, you also have limited control over your power as the placement of your explosions is somewhat random. As such to avoid any friendly fire, you must keep your distance from allies. You also can’t really control where your blasts hit with any degree of accuracy as you only have some ability to dictate their general direction and frequency (i.e., spam a general area). Your power has a relatively short range of no more than around 20 feet.

Scaffold (maybe bohu-esque)  
Cost: 12 SP  
You have the ability to create and alter building layouts, by creating architecture with your power. You can use this ability to slide walls around, create walls where there weren't any, create trapdoors, etc.  
Tōng Líng Tǎ  
Cost: 13 SP  
You can send out terrain altering pulses that shape it to your design. Within your scope is raising new buildings, restructuring existing ones, including the direct control of the features of the building, or razing structures entirely. This allows you to maintain and clean buildings. Though you’re too slow to use in a fast moving battle situation. You can create an entire palace and cancel out seismic events in your area of influence.

Saltykov  
Cost: 8 SP  
You compel others within your range to reverse allegiances, acting out with extreme prejudice against things they valued most, to the best of their abilities. The more they love it, the more they’ll want to destroy or ruin it.

Ravager  
Cost: 8 SP  
You can imbue weapons, objects, and ammunition with the ability to inflict gradually worsening wounds that smoke and sting. All wounds you inflict will bleed, fester and permanently scar if not tended to, with scratches having the potential to worsen into evisceration. You have a clairvoyant awareness of those you wound. You also have enhanced strength, reflexes, and agility.

Winter  
Cost: 10 SP  
You can create a dampening effect that causes bullets to lose their inertia, heat to seep out of areas, energy attacks to lose their fizzle, and humans to lose their will. You can concentrate your power in a smaller area, halting all motion. Even at its widest and least intense, it reduced ambient temperatures to the point that moisture freezes in the air, creating a telltale mist. People under its effect experienced a mental torpor, feeling their thoughts slow to a crawl. They will stand still as if they died from the cold.

Shatterbird  
Cost: 8 SP  
You have the ability to manipulate silicon through high-frequency sounds, giving you essentially perfect control over all glass, sand, and other siliceous compounds.

Screamer  
Cost: 9 SP  
You have the ability to manipulate sound within roughly a mile's radius. You can use it to amplify your voice, alter it to match others, throw it to speak directly into people's ears, or cancel out sounds you don't want to hear. Your abilities also allow you to hear sounds in any given area. It is almost impossible to cancel you out as you can transmit sound, and by extension words, through multiple mediums. This includes bone, thus earplugs or earmuffs are ineffective. You can modulate the sound to the point that people will hear what you’re saying as if it’s the voice within your head. You can overload everyone in your range with a deafening jarring scream.  
Triumph  
Cost: 4 SP  
Your power is sound manipulation, of which you can control its force, area of effect, and unleash it in bursts. You also sport a mild healing factor, healing quicker than average with minimal scarring. Your sound blasts are capable of punching through concrete.

Psychosoma  
Cost: 6 SP  
You can encase people within semi-real illusions of monsters that are under your control. While encased in this monster form, the victim is completely unconscious for the duration. The physical form of these monsters can range widely; from large wall-crawling spiders to nightmarish tentacle creatures to lizard-like beasts with razor-sharp claws and teeth. ~~However, these illusions are as fragile as glass and the victim will return to normal once the illusion is broken.\\~~

### Power Fusion

Armamentarium  
Cost: 2 SP  
Required:Blaster (Deadshot)  
Required:(Blaster/Shaker) Musketeer  
Required: Miss Militia, or Hana  
Required:Full Set  
You attained Armamentarium’s full potential, at least what’s afforded in a \[Cycle\].  
You can bring a stockpile of weaponry, around a thousand (1000) from every stretch of the imagination, collected by the Entities’ previous host species. Ranging from primal armaments (i.e. swords, spears, halberds, shields, scythe, etc.), modern (handguns, SMGs, rifles, snipers, LMGs, rocket, and grenade launchers, etc.) to sci-fi-like weaponry (holo-weaponry, energy weapons, mass-drive weapons, etc.). And that's not all, with defensive armaments such as armor/exoskeletons, too. This contains the advancements and specialties they relied on in all the exotic and alien splendor.  
This stockpile is unilaterally and telekinetically controlled, each weapon a mental instance to handle its mechanisms as well as modifying its attachments and blueprints, even including exotic effects to any part of the payload or chassis, such as kinetic-absorbent slugs or automatic laser rifles with ray-beam modes. When it comes to controlling your weaponry, instead of disappearing once their mags are empty, they automatically refill, and your marksmanship is further honed to its own caliber: do you know what those assassins from Wanted can do with a gun? It’s that with ricocheting as cherry on top… nearing as a homing effect.  
Although your armory is war-ending, there are some limitations: the more complex and dangerous an armament, the more taxing, with less variant weaponry you can conjure, i.e., you can use an array of 1000 .22LR pistols or rifles with no sweat off your brow, yet more than ten thermobaric nuclear energy LMGs? Not if your life counts on it. Oh, and your Shard prevents you from summoning the most devastating of the bunch, for “fairness’” sake, it said.  
*The Sieging Stronghold*  
Required:(Shaker/Master) Tower Defence  
Required:(Tinker) Fortifications and Artillery  
You’ve become a walking fortress and siege engine, as your ability to create and manipulate defense structures and improve upon their foundations is incorporated into Armamentarium.  
Armamentarium improves the constructs’ formidability, with turrets gaining adaptability in the shape of mobility and cutting-edge tinkertech, e.g., mobile missile launchers or AI-assisted ionic rays; barriers are now more responsive to the environment and opposition, e.g., barrier adapt an electrostatic coat to avoid climbing; and minions inherit the skills of those that utilized Armamentarium’s armament as echoes of warriors.  
All of this helps to build siege engines and strongpoints, a stronghold’s polar opposite: turrets become artillery and ordnance, barriers take an offensive use, and minions fire set off suppressive fire to gain ground.  
Your energy pool efficiency is enhanced to make a defense that leaves Rogal Dorn blushing with only half of your energy expenditure, aiding in loosening your inherent limitations on summoning weaponry and strongpoints.  
*WMD*  
Required:Chaotic Tinker  
Your \[Cycle\] restrictions on how catastrophic you can be are lifted. With Chaotic Tinker, once your seed of havoc is born, the most dangerous weaponry and ordnance the Entities ever encountered are free to be summoned: war machines to raze cities, a matter-annihilating cannon, or a grav-gun that fires black holes, anything that of short ruins the ecosystem of a planet is on a charred silver platter.  
Blaster (Deadshot)  
Cost: 1 SP  
You have an intuitive understanding of angles and trajectories, granting you nearly perfect aim. You can line up your shots nearly instantly, even for complex trajectories where the projectile bounces. You are still capable of missing if your aim is thrown off.  
Soldier of the Future  
Cost: 8 SP  
Required: Hana, or Miss Militia  
Required: (Tinker) Revolution, or (Tinker) Reproduction  
You can use Miss Militia's power with any Tinkertech weapon you've touched.  
Miss Militia  
Cost: 4 SP  
You can form weapons from a semi-sentient blue-black blur of energy. These weapons have unlimited ammo and can only be mundane in origin. You also have a perfect memory and don't need to sleep.  
(Blaster/Shaker) Musketeer  
Cost: 15 SP  
Your shard enables you to summon single-use muskets around you, which turn into mist and disappear after use. These muskets are extremely durable, capable of withstanding multiple hits from mid to high-tier brutes before breaking. Additionally, they have virtually zero bullet drop when fired. You can choose how powerful each musket is when summoning it. Once fired, the musket ball can be strong enough to pierce titanium and even cause high-tier brutes to have second thoughts. You can summon as many muskets as you want, but you are only limited to having 200 active muskets around you at a time.  
Your shard also grants you the power of telekinesis when summoning your muskets, along with excellent marksmanship. This telekinesis allows you to manipulate and control the muskets as if they were another limb, knowing their exact positions and where they are aiming at all times. The telekinesis also extends to controlling the musket ball once fired, making it easier for you to hit your targets accurately.  
Although you have perfect control over the muskets when they are close to you, your telekinetic control weakens with distance, reducing both accuracy and control.  
*The American Way*  
Required:Miss Militia  
Your muskets can now be any mundane, modern firearm. They will appear fully loaded. The firearm automatically disappears after it has used up all its ammunition.  
*The 2° Amendment*  
Required:(Tinker) Guns  
You can create musket variants of any gun you have made before. If you have The American Way then you can summon full fledged versions of any gun you have made, although it will be under the same restrictions, making it disappear after it has used up its ammo.  
Full Set  
Cost: 2 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Armor  
Required:(Tinker) Shields  
Required: (Tinker) Swords, or (Tinker) Guns  
Your newfound specialization possesses the unique ability to create gear that surpasses the sum of its individual components. You have the skill to craft Shields or Armors that not only absorb attacks but can also utilize the absorbed energy to power your Armor, recharge your Shields, or even redirect the energy back through your Guns/Swords. Moreover, your Armor has the capability to enhance your Shields, and your Attacks can extract energy from adversaries, be it blood, electricity, or even esoteric elements like momentum.

[(Tinker) Shields](https://docs.google.com/document/d/10iXeteuLtMn8lAAAEjSYL5M_GQZsBYuDL9xo5bJ-QRQ/edit?pli=1&tab=t.0#bookmark=id.w6f0po54jl5r)

Empire of Sound  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:Sound Engineer  
Required:(Shaker) The Sound of Silence  
Required: (Shaker/Thinker) Omni-Kinesis, or (Shaker) Natural World  
Your control of the physical, either by conducting an orchestral interplay of matter and energy and/or being smitten by nature’s song, is now dancing to the tune of your anthem.  
Your knack for engineering tinkertech for sound and music, while using your control of vibrations as a medium, went through a breakthrough owing to its newfound handle of cymatics, vibrations giving matter form which, when vibrated, generates energy. Attuning your tinkertech to these frequencies is as easy as a tune-up, taking many forms: a guitar, a microphone, a Sound or DJ deck balancing ease-of-use and intricacy.  
How this works is simple, your music and melodies contain frequencies and vibrations modulating and altering the world at large and/or emulating the world’s experiences tempered by your message/intention and what you intend with a track, the physical world adjusting by “mood” and “vibe” of the song or melody, to see creation come undone.  
Almost anything can be accomplished through this, with imagination and Entity-imposed restrictions being the only limitations.  
(Tinker) Sound/Vibration  
Cost: 5 SP  
Your tinker-tech specialises in the phenomena of acoustics and vibrations, capable of constructing sonar radars able to picture cities, and acoustic cannons with both concussive and disorienting effects. Anything relating to sound and vibrational frequencies can be replicated through this.  
Sound Engineer  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Sound/Vibration  
Not only can you fashion contraptions using sound or vibrational frequencies, but you can also use sounds and vibrations themselves in the form of music. It can range from record production to audio engineering surpassing conventional limitations, such as implanting subtle or overt Master effects within your work.  
(Shaker) The Sound of Silence  
Cost: 25 SP  
Hear that? Perhaps you didn’t. Sound and vibrations are yours to control. Among these abilities, is the power to generate and control shockwaves; you can generate shockwaves strong enough to send large cyborgs flying off their feet, or to destroy objects, to the point that you could easily collapse buildings with them. Alongside this, you can also manipulate or shatter things with acoustic resonance. You are also able to use vibrations for sensory purposes, such as with echolocation. This manipulation of vibrations also allows you to deafen or even remove sound and vibrations from you and your surroundings, rendering yourself and/or the environment silent.  
(Shaker/Thinker) Omni-Kinesis  
Cost: 25 SP  
In a radius of 50 meters around you, with nothing but your will alone you are capable of shaping the physical world. Moving objects, generating and manipulating all forms of energy or matter, or even creating psychic constructs.  
The world is a vast ocean of vibration, matter, and energy to your senses, and all it takes is a thought to send it moving according to your wishes. Complex systems such as biology and technology will require a great deal of practice before you can reliably work them the same way you would matter and energy, with other powers here being far better at doing so and developing faster.

Erebus  
Cost: 3 SP  
Required:(Mover/Stranger) Shadow Diver  
Required:(Master) Shadow Servant  
Required:(Shaker/Mover) Nyx  
Required:Shade  
Required:Chiaroscuro  
The combination of your various darkness powers has elevated you to the illustrious status of being the very manifestation of darkness.  
Your weakness to light is diminished, but not removed entirely, and your range increases by two orders of magnitude, enough to drown some smaller cities in darkness. The power of your shadows is greatly magnified, such that your shadowy constructs may tear through Endbringer flesh like butter, only encountering difficulty with the deepest layers. Your Shade is even further amplified by this, becoming a veritable juggernaut even from the moment of its creation and only getting stronger from there.  
Your Breaker form has shared traits with your Shade, gaining its ability to attack, consume, and mimic shadows and giving the Shade the Breaker Form’s ability to absorb darkness to regenerate. Additionally, absorbing darkness no longer just heals but also increases strength temporarily, such that “consuming” the darkness of a large cavern would be enough to manhandle Endbringers with ease. You can even merge with your Shade, forming a single existence with the combined power of both of you.  
You possess much expertise traveling and manipulating the sea of shadows, being able to lurk within it’s depths indefinitely. Furthermore, you are able to use your shadows as a bridge to banish others into its abyssal darkness, trapping them there and using its darkness to smother the light within them. Furthermore, smothering someone within the shadow realm counts as consuming them, increasing your power and knowledge.  
Lastly, your initial pool for creating shadowy servants has grown in size, enough that you could create a single servant on par with an Endbringer, and continues to grow at a much faster rate when in darkness. Furthermore, the strength of your servants has increased as well, with their baseline starting point already being high-level Brutes. With this you may eventually create an entire army of servants on par with Endbringers.  
(Mover/Stranger) Shadow Diver  
Cost: 12 SP  
Once cloaked in darkness, you may transform into an intangible, fluid-like substance, merging seamlessly within the shadows. Within this form, you swim and dive through the darkness as effortlessly as a shark navigates the open ocean. Movement within this shadowy domain is an alien experience—less like swimming and more akin to floating weightlessly through the void.  
This shadowy expanse—a pocket dimension sustained by your shard—exists as an otherworldly reflection of reality, directly tied to the shadows it originates from. The size and depth of this shadow sea mirror the dimensions of the casting shadow: the larger and darker the umbra, the more expansive and profound the realm becomes.  
Skimming the surface of this stygian sea allows you to observe and eavesdrop on the physical world through the shadow's origin. Beneath this surface, however, the sea reveals its true mysteries—hidden fissures and caverns leading to other shadows across reality, connected to distant pockets of darkness. While submerged, you remain utterly undetectable, eluding powers designed to pierce through concealment.  
Yet, this shadowy sanctuary is not without its limits. Your presence within any single shade is finite, forcing you to constantly move in shallower shadows or risk ejection if you linger too long. While deeper, darker shadows grant extended respite without disruption.  
As you descend into the shadowy abyss. You'll find your perception of reality warping as the fabric of reality begins to twist and distort. Near the surface, the effects are subtle, with only minor disruptions to time and space. But the deeper you venture, the more profound the distortion becomes. Distant locations may take less or more time than reason would logically dictate.  
This dissonance creates a surreal, dreamlike journey through the shadow's unfathomable depths, where the boundaries of reality blur and yield to your passage.  
(Master) Shadow Servant  
Cost: 15 SP  
You possess a master power enabling the creation of shadow minions of any desired shape or size —be it bipeds, quadrupeds, or formless entities resembling slimes— while always retaining the color and form of shadows. You have a pool of power that governs the "birth" and sustenance of these creatures, offering a choice between prioritizing quantity or enhancing their individual quality. You can have up to 15 regular minions, create a super one capable to withstand a normal battle Endbringer most powerful attack, or any combination in between. While your minions cannot wield Trump powers, the only limitation on the number of powers they can possess is determined by your power pool.  
Shade  
Cost: 6 SP  
Required:(Master) Detached Shadow  
Your Shadow has evolved into a Shade, gaining a few abilities. First, it can now directly engage and attack other shadows, inflicting physical damage on the person or creature that casts the targeted shadow. This ability effectively allows your Shade to strike at foes from a distance or even in total darkness. Additionally, your Shade can consume other shadows, a process that not only harms the original owner but also transfers their strength and vitality to both you and your Shade, enhancing your physical abilities and extending your Shade's reach and potency.  
Moreover, by consuming a shadow, your Shade gains access to the memories and experiences that took place within that shadow. This means that by devouring the shadow of a person or creature, you can uncover their secrets, learn about their past, or even gain insights into hidden locations or plans. The more shadows your Shade consumes, the stronger and more knowledgeable it becomes, gradually evolving into a powerful entity with its own reservoir of collective memories, drawn from the countless shadows it has devoured.  
As a final ability, your Shade can now cloak itself in the shadows it consumes, allowing it to adopt the appearance, size, or even the behavior of the shadows it has eaten. This makes it an excellent tool for deception, infiltration, or laying traps, as your Shade can disguise itself as a seemingly harmless or mundane entity before striking.  
(Master) Detached Shadow  
Cost: 9 SP  
You can detach your shadow, allowing it to move around freely and act as it wishes. It can freely travel through or stay within other shadows, however its movements will be limited when in the light. You can also manifest your shadow, giving it an actual 3 dimensional form instead of its original 2 dimensional form. The shadow can morph itself, however limited only to what types of shadows you can make via shadow puppets. Your shadow will be stronger the bigger it naturally would be, and the more shadows there are in the area. When detached you will have no shadow.  
*Shadow Lands*  
Required:(Master) Shadow Servant  
Your pool increases slowly, the rate increasing by staying in darker places. This allows you to create more shadow minions. All your shadow minions also gain the ability to both stay within your shadow and travel in a 2 dimensional form.  
(Shaker/Mover) Nyx  
Cost: 20 SP  
You now have the ability to manipulate darkness and shadows with precision and control. Able to create, shape, and harness them for various purposes. While Darkness is mostly used to cloud everything into complete obscurity, it can also be harnessed as both the absence of light and a tangible substance. With it, you possess the capacity to manipulate entities existing within darkness, establish and dissolve shields and areas of absolute darkness, construct tools and weaponry sharp enough to rend through steel like a hot knife through butter, make shadowy servants that are able to go toe to toe with high-level brutes, teleport vast distances by traversing through shadows, your versatility with this power is bound only by the extent of your imagination. Your range extends within a radius of 200 meters around you. You also get unlimited multitasking with this.  
It is worth noting that powers based on light are particularly potent against you. However, your ability to withstand and resist these light-based abilities increases in darker environments, allowing you to maintain a stronger defense against them.  
Chiaroscuro  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required: (Shaker/Mover) Nyx, or (Shaker/Mover) Eos  
The essence of your chosen power has fully infused into your very being, granting you the ability to transform into a pure Breaker state in which you consist entirely of your “element”, whether light or dark.  
In this form, you can manipulate your size, shape and overall consistency at will, allowing you to shift seamlessly from being as solid as steel to as fluid as running water. You can regenerate in this form by drawing upon your respective “element” from your surrounding environment as fuel. Additionally, you are self-sustaining in this Breaker state, no longer requiring food, water, air, or sleep, and can remain in this form indefinitely.  
However, in this Breaker state, you are particularly vulnerable to powers and abilities tied to your opposite “element”. Despite this weakness, environments containing significant amounts of your chosen “element” will help you withstand and resist these attacks.  
If you possess both (Shaker/Mover) Nyx and (Shaker/Mover) Eos, this vulnerability to extremes of light and dark is completely removed and you can blend both light and dark simultaneously into your Breaker state, producing a harmonious duality that greatly enhances your versatility and power.

Kinetics & Dynamics  
Cost: 7 SP  
Required:Assault  
Required:Ballistic  
Required:Krieg  
Your powers centred around kinetic energy have unified together, granting you near-complete control over all kinetic-related energies and forces within your vicinity.  
Your control over kinetic energy extends to a 200-metre radius of yourself. Within this range, you are capable of seamlessly absorbing, imbuing, redirecting and transferring nearly all kinetic forces, whether they're related to motion, acceleration, impact, friction or otherwise. Furthermore, your capacity to store kinetic energy has become virtually limitless, allowing you to even absorb physical attacks from an Endbringer.  
Complementing this control is a secondary ability that provides an intuitive awareness of all kinetic energy transfers and movements within your sphere of influence. This understanding is detailed and immediate, enabling you to instinctively react and alter the energy dynamics around you if under threat.  
Thanks to this awareness, your application of this power is also capable of being highly elaborate. For example, you could potentially emulate telekinesis via the remote application and manipulation of objects' kinetic energies. However, such fine manipulation requires intense concentration with your multitasking capacity also limiting how much you can manipulate at any given time.

Lord of Frenzied Flame  
Cost: 4 SP  
Required:(Shaker) Frenzied Flame  
Required:(Master/Trump) Open Eyes  
Required:(Shaker) Bedlam  
Required: Ruler of the Primordial Flames, or (Breaker/Shaker) Hellfire  
Your flames crackle and flare a mad glint, something hungry and tired, so tired of the world, of its complexities, the misery and hardship that comes with it. This flame will burn it all, so that all be one, once again.  
Your fire shows an encroaching and/or corruptive trait, any living thing scorched or burned will be corrupted or driven to a frenzy by your flames, slowly “burning” their body and mind, in turn, twisting and warping them to chaotic messes, or their minds are left charred by the Flame’s leaving them stark raving mad. \[Evolution\] is the process from which the powers and enchantments can grow from a low T1 to a High T3 and above. This growth is fueled by the pool to cause it to grow in as many directions as possible. You may also increase the rarity of all members of your network at your discretion. \[Evolution\]’s interaction with the network does not stop there. It will also be analyzing their power usage to find interactions between powers depending on their synergy and compatibility. This data will be used to constantly polish their powers in terms of efficiency, use, and configurations (like limitations and Manton Effect).  
\[Fusion\] is quite simply, the fusion of two different powers or enchantments into one. \[Fusion\] can also be used to divide powers into component powers as weak as T0. This is done to combine different aspects of different powers together without having to fuse them completely. Used in conjunction with \[Evolution\], a single power can be expanded upon to create an entire library of powers, with \[Creation\] expanding upon that even further. Manifested items can also be subject to \[Fusion\] allowing you to combine them into higher rarity items or divide them into lower rarity items. \[Fusion\] also benefits the network by allowing powers used by different members to interact with each other in specific and targeted ways or preventing interference between them.

However the biggest change is you can now enhance and enchant other people the same way you would yourself or items.  
Celestial Artificer  
Cost: 20 SP  
Required: Dauntless, or Shawn  
Required:(Trump/Tinker) Enhancer  
You have become the Celestial Artificer, gaining the ability to enhance items through two primary functions: Upgrading and Enchanting. Upgrading allows the wielder to elevate an item's rarity, which determines its level of power and quality. The rarity levels are as follows:  
\* Trash (Gray) \- These are mundane items without any effects, akin to common everyday objects like rocks or kitchen knives. They can hold a single enchantment.  
\* Common (White) \- Representing Items with weak effects. Possess 2 enchantment slots and costing 3 charges to raise from Trash.  
\* Uncommon (Green) \- Moving up the ranks, Uncommon items possess 3 enchantment slots, and a Mundane rarity can be upgraded to this level with 7 charges.  
\* Rare (Blue) \- With 5 enchantment slots, their potential for unique effects is expanded, and they can be upgraded from Uncommon with 13 charges.  
\* Epic (Purple) \- Powerful Items with 7 enchantment slots, and requiring 19 charges to upgrade from Rare.  
\* Exotic (Yellow) \- Minor Artifacts possessing 9 enchantment slots, and requiring 25 charges to upgrade from Epic.  
\* Unique (Red) \- Representing Grand Artifacts, Unique items have 12 enchantment slots and need 32 charges to upgrade from Exotic.  
\* Legendary (Orange) \- The penultimate items of this grade possess 15 enchantment slots and can be upgraded from Unique with 40 charges.  
\* Mythical (Black) \- The pinnacle, these are Divine Artifacts, with 20 enchantment slots, and are immensely potent, requiring 50 charges to upgrade from Legendary.

The second function, Enchanting, involves applying anomalous effects to items. Every enchantment costs a single "Charge," and the wielder gains three Charges every day. The only limits of enchantments is the wielder's creativity, from enhancing a blade's sharpness to imbuing healing aura or curses onto an item, with higher rarity grades unlocking access to more powerful and unique enchantments. Mythical and Legendary enchantments may require more than one Charge to be applied.

Personal Military  
Cost: 20 SP  
Required:(Master/Thinker) Personal Army  
Your personal army has improved, letting you summon more soldiers, vehicles, and equipment than you started with.  
You have no limit to the number of soldiers or vehicles you can summon, only how many you can summon at once. Per week, you can summon an additional 10 soldiers, 5 lighter vehicles, such as armored cars, 5 heavier vehicles, such as tanks, 5 smaller aircraft, such as fighter planes, and 2 heavier aircraft, such as bombers. The vehicles you summon will have their crew summoned with them.  
Your soldiers are now superhuman, which opens the door for new classes of soldiers you can summon. Your standard soldier now possesses peak human physical capabilities, as well as an increase in skill, allowing them to make key tactical decisions on the fly. Your soldiers can also summon needed ammunition for both themselves and any vehicle you summoned. You will even find yourself and your soldiers immune to friendly fire.  
You can summon ‘classes’, special types of soldiers that have their profession ramped to higher capabilities. These build off of your standard soldiers, keeping their superhuman capabilities. These classes are split into two versions, lesser and higher.  
Lesser classes are classes that provide a smaller amount of effects. This can range from a cook that can produce extremely good food, a general that can command an army without speaking an order, a medic that can induce regeneration, or a mechanic that can repair vehicles at an abnormally fast rate. A single lesser class can be summoned once a week.  
Higher classes are the pinnacle of classes, with a variety of potential powers this can range from a cook that makes food that grants abilities, a general that has a lesser version of your summoning abilities, a medic that can bring back the recently deceased, or a mechanic that can maintain and repair tinker tech. A single higher class can be summoned once a month.  
Should any of your soldiers die, they can be re-summoned after an hour, and any damaged vehicle will find itself fixed and in a retrievable position after an hour.  
The Trees Started Speaking Vietnamese

Required: Air Land and Sea, or And The Caissons Go Rolling Along

Not So Scarlet  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Trump/Master) Chrysalis  
The colour of the highlight of your Kamikos now covers their entire body, and you are no longer limited to only having one; you are now able to instantly turn any of your butterflies that enter contact with you into Kamikos, allowing you to have a greater number of Champions.

(Trump/Master) Chrysalis  
Cost: 25 SP  
You gain the capacity to sense sentiments and desires within 100 kilometers of you. By concentrating on the sentiments/desires someone is feeling, you gain knowledge of what caused them and can hear what they are currently thinking.  
You are able to create white butterflies that you can sense through and command them by giving them orders telepathically, though this telepathic link only works within the range of your emotion sense. Within you, there's a large pool of energy that you can imbue into one of your butterflies through touch. This turns that butterfly into a Kamiko, and their colour becomes black with highlights of a colour of your choice. The pool regenerates slowly, but eating food fills it completely, and with time, it will grow in size. Kamikos are extremely flexible, giving them the capacity to pass through very small gaps and be able to sense emotions in a much smaller range than yours. You can only have one Kamiko at a time; trying to make another one will just result in you wasting the energy from your pool.  
Your Kamiko can possess an object that someone has an emotional connection with; the possessed object becomes black, a mental connection with that being is established, and their sentiments/desires are amplified and reinforced. This connection allows you to access their senses and telepathically communicate with them. Every time you do that, a glowing (with the colour of the highlight of your Kamiko) outline of a mask in the shape of a butterfly appears in front of their and your faces. You can offer them a transformation that will change their body, make them have unlimited stamina, and give them powers (being able to amplify and change existing ones), together with a name for this transformation. If they agree to it, their body will be engulfed by a bubbling energy of the colour of your Kamiko, upon which the change is made, and they will become your Champion. If their object breaks, their transformation ends, and all their active power effects will cease to exist. The same applies if you make the Kamiko leave its object. Although you normally can only have one Champion at a time due to your Kamiko limit, if multiple people share the same object and their sentiments and desires align, they will become multiple Champions or fuse into a single one. You can only retrieve a Kamiko and communicate with your Champion within your emotional sense range.  
The powers from the transformation are fueled by your pool of energy, and the stronger they are, the more energy they consume, while the maximum strength of the powers you can give is 30 SP total. The transformation must align with your Champions sentiments/desires, the context behind those feelings, and themselves. You can't give someone who refuses to hurt anyone under any circumstances a power that can only be used to hurt, nor can you give someone who is tired of running away from their problems sentient minions that they can command from another city, but you could give the first one a power whose capacity to hurt is secondary or give the second one the capacity to create clones that house his consciousness. If you Champion yourself, you won't be able to change or amplify Chrysalis, and if a Champion has the capacity to amplify or grant powers to others, it must be either temporary, limited to only 1 or both.  
If you have Shardless or Esoteric Knowledge, your pool of energy will instead be magic aligned with the concepts of Transmission, Influence, and Change, with each concept giving you an extra ability; with Transmission comes the capacity to temporarily transfer to your Champions any of your powers with the exception of Chrysalis; with Influence comes the capacity to compel someone to accept your offer of Championship and with Change comes the capacity for a transformation to become permanent. If your Champion stays transformed for a long time, the stronger the Champion the more time they need. If a Champion becomes permanent, they no longer need your Magic to use their powers, and you can use your Kamiko on someone else. You are still able to communicate with them as if they had a Kamiko. Besides that, it allows your Champions to actually have esoteric abilities like magic instead of imitations, and with time and effort, you can develop new capabilities based on those concepts or enhance ones that you already have (like making your Kamiko phase through walls). Those capabilities will use your pool of magic to function.

Vodou  
Cost: 18 SP

You gained the ability to construct dolls through which you can manipulate others. After constructing or getting a basic doll, you can imbue it to utilize your power. When imbuing a doll with your power, you have two choices concerning linking to someone. Either you can establish a permanent link to someone upon the doll’s creation, or to leave it blank.

If a link is established at creation the doll’s connection can temporarily or indefinitely be overridden as long as the doll has something attached to it representing another target, but will immediately revert if the item loses contact with the doll. The doll will require no item to affect its normal target.  
If a doll is left blank, you can instead establish permanent links later on as long as you attach something representing the target on the doll. If it directly belonged to the target such as a lock of hair, the doll’s link is established immediately, if it merely represents the target such as a commonly distributed picture such as a newspaper clipping it takes 1 day for the doll’s link to establish. Once the link is established the item no longer needs to be attached, and the link can be overwritten with another by simply following the process again.

The link is permanent unless broken by you. If the link is broken and the doll is still intact, you can establish it with someone else or a previous target without having to construct a new doll. The doll after you imbue it becomes almost entirely indestructible, requiring an All or Nothing power to destroy it. This includes any writing you make on the doll yourself.  
By holding the doll you can will it to grow into a person sized doll, allowing you the room to write on them, and to shrink it back to normal size at will. Whatever you write on the dolls becomes true for the one they’re affecting. The dolls will know what you intend with each word you write, so writing “tall” will make them as tall as you wanted them to be. You still have to make your wording complete.  
By focusing you can imbue a word with far more meaning into it than its normal definition, turning into a Major Word, taking effect when they are written and bypassing the need for full wording. You can create a Major word once a week, after creation the Major word can be used as many times as you want. The Major Word can also be used normally whenever you wish, and the same word can be turned into multiple versions of a Major Word, producing different effects with the same writing.  
You have a limit of 10 words per doll upon creation, however each day the doll remains in existence the limit of words increases by half. Others can write on the dolls if you allow it, but only if you allow it. You can wipe off any writing at any time without any effort.  
The doll can also be used to manipulate a target in a more traditional way, such as throwing them or crushing them by crushing the dolls. This only happens when you wish for it to. The target does not need to be a person, the doll can affect any being.

Sean Connery, Baba Yaga, The Punisher, The Boogeyman, The First Hunter, The Big Boss, Doctor Van Helsing—what do all of these names have in common? They are all elderly individuals working in professions where people die young. Now, you can claim to be their equal (or even surpass them by cheating using powers). You can't lose in any skill-based combat, whether it involves cold weapons like swords, shields, even armor, or hot weapons, whether they are old, new, or Tinker-tech. Everything about you, including your limbs, is to be considered lethal and would almost certainly be banned by the Geneva Convention. Not even precogs on the likes of Cortessa or Ziz can match your skill\! Just don't expect this to save you if they drop a nuke on your head.  
(Thinker) Precognitive Combat  
Cost: 6 SP  
You are a Combat Thinker, specializing in the role of a one-(wo)man army, excelling in both one-on-one and one-against-many combat scenarios. Your ability to anticipate actions before they occur enables you to perform mind-boggling feats of finesse and skill. Among those who rely on conventional methods, you are considered the pinnacle of combat prowess including tactics, strategy and skills, making even individuals like Uber and Victor appear somewhat gimmicky in comparison. Additionally, you attain a nominal level of fitness(if you don't already possess it or a superior level) and an understanding of how to best train and maintain your body health.

Comprehension  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required: (Thinker) Omniscient, or (Thinker) Vision  
You no longer gain just an answer to any questions you pose, instead you gain true comprehension and understanding of all answers you get. Instead of simply knowing that 2+2=4, you now truly understand why and how. This also applies to any knowledge you come across in any manner. This knowledge cannot harm you in any way, regardless of its nature.  
(Thinker) Omniscient  
Cost: 25 SP  
You can answer any question anyone asks you, except that if you don't have Negentropy you can't answer how to solve/negate entropy. You can ask yourself questions and automatically know the answer to any question asked of you, even if the answer to that question harms you.  
(Thinker) Vision  
Cost: 35 SP  
You can simulate any scenario you can come up with.

Unseen  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Stranger) Unnoticeable  
People won't notice you even if you attack them now. Nothing you do or say will get them to acknowledge your existence. They will still be able to perceive you, but they will not be able to act on that knowledge consciously. They will subconsciously move away to avoid hitting you, and will not question why they are suddenly hurt if you attack them, in fact they will not even act on the fact that they are hurt.  
Together, We are forgotten  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Stranger) Unnoticeable  
You can now share and make people immune to the effects of your power.  
(Stranger) Unnoticeable  
Cost: 10 SP  
People won't notice you unless you attack them. You could go the the bathroom on their food, and while they wouldn't eat the food, they wouldn't acknowledge your existence. They will know something is up though, since there was poop in their food.

Computronio  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Neural Network  
You possess access to a network comprising 768 Nodes (increasing to 1024 with Negentropy). For every 8 unallocated nodes, your thinking speed escalates by 25% in an additive manner. Nodes are designed to store approximately 5 Petabytes of information.  
Thinker powers consume a number of nodes roughly equivalent to their SP plus one (e.g., Thinker 2 requires 3 Nodes, Thinker 3 requires 4 Nodes). Your maximum budget for a Thinker power is 25 nodes.  
You can also create Tinker powers that starts with an empty database; You have to fill it with data and nodes according to the square of their SP (e.g., 0 requires 1 point, 3 requires 9 points). Your maximum budget for a Tinker power is 81 nodes.  
Hybrid ratings ('Tinker/Thinker 3') generally tend to cost higher than simple abilities but less than the sum of their parts.  
Network Expansion  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Neural Network  
Your mind is a fascinating, self-expanding construct, designed to evolve over time. Every week you gain an additional 16 (32 with negentropy) nodes.  
As your mind expands, you can handle increasingly complex tasks, analyze data at even higher resolutions, and seamlessly integrate new abilities, making it more versatile with each passing week.  
(Thinker) Neural Network  
Cost: 35 SP  
You have access to a network of 512 Nodes (768 with Negentropy) that can be used for several purposes. For every 16 unallocated nodes, your thinking speed is increased by 25% additively.  
Nodes can be used to store approximately 2.5 PB (petabytes) of information, this includes memories. One Node is sufficient to store a perfect snapshot of your brain.  
Nodes are also able to be grouped into a Module, this allows them to be programmed to perform various functions like keeping track of time, automatically creating a backup of your brain, processing your vision to parse any text and store it in a node, and more. If it can be done with a computer, it can be done with a module. One node has roughly the same processing power as a high end server.  
You can also use Nodes to create a Cluster, this allows them to host Thinker powers. THe power uses a number of nodes equivalent to the square of its rating (Thinker 2 takes 4 Nodes, Thinker 3 takes 9 Nodes, and so on). Your maximum rating is 9\. The powers can only use information gathered from your own senses, including any power-granted senses.

Klondike Bar  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Thinker/Master) Bribery Makes Everything Easier  
Your Bribery power's master component is greatly empowered allowing you to successfully bribe more people for far, far, cheaper than it normally would. Yes, including getting people to kill each other over ice cream bars, although with something that extreme it would take a significant amount of convincing for most people to even consider.  
(Thinker/Master) Bribery Makes Everything Easier  
Cost: 2 SP  
You gain a thinker ability to discern what would be the optimal bribe to convince a person or group to do a particular task for you. And a minor master ability to get said target to at least listen to your attempts to convince them to take the bribe in question and also not get second thoughts if they do go along with it.

Perfected Past Sight  
Cost: 8 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Past Sight  
Your viewing now applies retroactively. Any location or person that you have seen during your viewing, you can now apply this power on too. The restriction of it having to have been within the past day has been lifted.  
(Thinker) Past Sight  
Cost: 12 SP  
You are capable of viewing the past with perfect clarity, with the typical shard blindspots. This can be directed at a specific person that has been in your line of sight or a location that you have been at, within the past day. Time can be slowed down, paused or sped up during this viewing.

Magnetics, Daughter\! This is how they work\!  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Shaker/Blaster) Magnets, Son\! How do they work?  
You gain a Tinker specialization in magtech and related fields, allowing you to, among other things, expand your range using mobile range extenders and automate the field creation/operation  
*Electromagnetic Miracles*  
Required:Electro-Magneto  
Your Tinker specialization has now expanded from magtech to cover every possible aspect of electromagnetism with almost no restrictions. As a tinker, you are to the electromagnetic force what Hero was to wavelength manipulation.  
You can construct Tinkertech that creates illusions by manipulating electromagnetic light or build magnetic monopoles, advanced masers, absurdly efficient electromagnetic generators and even weapons that can negate the electromagnetic force entirely in a small area, destroying matter itself.  
Through your incredible grasp of this fundamental force of the universe, there is now little you cannot eventually do under the scope of electromagnetism with enough time, effort and materials.  
(Shaker/Blaster) Magnets, Son\! How do they work?  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can create and shape magnetic fields within a 100-meter range, field formation is instantaneous, powerful, and extremely precise. You are limited only by your concentration, focus, ingenuity, materials at hand, and the space available within your range. This can be used for applications such as manipulating, compressing, and launching metal, or anything else you can get to work through magnetic field interactions. This comes with a passive defensive shield that will protect you fully from shockwaves, and deflect magnetic attacks such as metals, electricity, or plasma.

[Memetic Me](#bookmark=id.h14l01txion4)

Multiversal Warping  
Cost: 4 SP  
Required:(Shaker/Mover) Dimensional Warping  
You are no longer limited to just your universe, allowing your manipulations to cross to other universes within your local multiverse. Taking Homecoming makes this ability Omniversal given the correct medium.  
(Shaker/Mover) Dimensional Warping  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can manipulate the fabric of spacetime, allowing you to make non-euclidean regions that defy conventional physics. This would allow you to make things bigger on the inside, an endlessly looping stairway, or even a time dilation room. There is a somatic component to this power, requiring that you stretch and pull at the very fabric of spacetime with your bare hands. You may not reverse time, and you cannot cross dimensions either. The better your knowledge of a region, the higher the quality of the manipulations you do, making it almost impossible to accurately portal to a place you've never been to before. Due to your manipulation's somatic nature, complex or long-range manipulations require much more time to enact, possibly increasing by several magnitudes.

Exotic Creation  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Shaker) Baryonic Creation  
Your power of creation has now expanded, allowing you to create exotic matter from seemingly nothing. Exotic matter is the colloquial term used to describe highly "unnatural" matter that is not composed of protons, neutrons and electrons. One of the most common forms of exotic matter in nature is a so-called 'nuclear pasta', a form of structured neutronium that can only exist within the crusts of neutron stars.  
(Shaker) Baryonic Creation  
Cost: 15 SP  
The power of creation is in your hands\! How quickly you create complex matter from seemingly nothing entirely depends on the scale, complexity and your understanding of the end product. Creating a cubic foot of steel would only take moments, while an assault rifle will take minutes. However, something complex like a modern car would probably take a few hours or more, assuming you understand its inner workings.

Overclock  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Breaker/Trump) Golden Form  
You may choose to overclock your Golden Form, increasing it’s abilities and enhancements a hundred fold, but it’ll start an internal timer of 30 minutes, after which your Golden Form will turn off and become inaccessible for a period of 24 hours.  
(Breaker/Trump) Golden Form  
Cost: 30 SP  
You’ve gained the ability to change into a powerful breaker form, converting your body into a semi-solid/liquid energy with its initial form resembling you in a full body cloak of golden flames. All your abilities are massively enhanced from your previous form, a normal human would be capable of overpowering Alexandria in strength and durability, sheer speed to run from one side of the planet to the other in a minute, and a reaction time to easily handle that kind of speed. This enhancement is extended to all your abilities, including other powers. The breaker form can be confined to a single part or individual parts of your body if you wish, and switching between your normal form and breaker form will instantly heal any injury.  
Alongside this is the ability to manipulate the energy your body is made from, allowing you to freely shape it into whatever you desire such as massive hands, a large animal form, or even weapons. The energy your body produces and is made from can be expelled as powerful blasts or used to imbue any other abilities you possess to further enhance them. You can channel any abilities you possess through your energy form as if they were your own body. You also possess a secondary ability allowing you unlimited multitasking in regards to your energy form.  
You cannot access any of the abilities from the form without using your breaker form, and can choose to change the colors of your breaker form at will. The transformation between forms is instantaneous.

Fast Forward  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Striker) Rewind  
You can choose to fast forward anything you touch to a possible future state instead. You still retain the same amount of control as previous, allowing you to selectively choose how and what gets fast forwarded.  
(Striker) Rewind  
Cost: 9 SP  
You can selectively rewind the state of anything you touch, including yourself, to a previous state. You can do things such as rewinding your physical state to heal injuries or repair objects, rewinding someone’s mind to erase select portions of their memories, or even rewind someone’s entire state to resurrect them. You can selectively choose what aspects to rewind such as only physical, to restore someone to a younger and healthy body without erasing their memories, or perhaps just healing someone’s injuries they have gotten from training without removing any benefits from said training.

Clone Master  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Master) Cloning  
You are no longer limited to only cloning parahumans. You can now absorb the DNA of multiple beings, and then produce clones of them simultaneously. This allows you to create a small army of clones, each with different powers and abilities, based on the original parahumans.  
Time taken to produce clones is also shortened to 60 minutes. If Fusion Master is taken then its shortened to 10 minutes.  
Fusion Master  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Master) Cloning  
You are no longer limited to only cloning parahumans. You can absorb the DNA of multiple creatures, and then produce a single clone that is a fusion off all of them. The resulting fusion is loyal to you and is an effective ally, able to use the combined abilities of both original parahumans. There is no limit to how many creatures that can be fused at once.  
(Master) Cloning  
Cost: 25 SP  
You can absorb the DNA of a single parahuman via touch, which can be used to produce a single clone of that parahuman. You can create multiple clones of a specific Parahuman. The cloning process takes 180 minutes, and the user can only create one clone at a time. During the cloning process, minor alterations to the clone's physical appearance and power expression can be made. You have a telepathic link with the clones, allowing you to command them from afar. All clones produced retain the original's memories and are capable of acting on their own. They are able to solve complex problems and think for themselves, and are given autonomy to make their own decisions. They are still loyal to their creator, but they are not completely obedient and can act independently if they believe it will benefit the creator. You are unable to create clones from other clones.

(Breaker) Rebirth  
Cost: 10 SP  
When you die, one of this power's charges is used, bringing you back to life a month later at some safe spot. You start with one charge, regenerate one charge per month without dying, and have a maximum capacity of 5 charges.  
Revive  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Breaker) Rebirth  
You will be able to revive anywhere between 10 seconds to 1 month after dying. When brought back to life, you will appear in a safe spot.  
Immortal  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Breaker) Rebirth  
The user will be able to now gain one charge every week, and have no limit on capacity. The user can gain charges faster by being in near death situations (combat) without dying.

The Man Of Tomorrow  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Upcoming Century  
Your unparalleled skill and knowledge in invention expand even further. You now possess the ability to invent anything that is theoretically possible within a 300-year timeframe. Furthermore, your deep understanding of scientific principles and engineering concepts has been greatly enhanced, allowing you to further expand any field of technology you're working on.  
With your newfound capabilities, you can push the boundaries of innovation and create advancements that can even surpass the initial 300-year projection. As time goes on, your creations become increasingly advanced, revolutionizing technology in ways previously unimaginable.  
(Tinker) Upcoming Century  
Cost: 18 SP  
You acquire the unparalleled skill and knowledge to invent anything that is theoretically possible within a century. With a deep understanding of scientific principles, engineering concepts, and innovative thinking, you possess the ability to bring forth groundbreaking creations and technological advancements.  
Armed with this expertise, you can conceive and develop revolutionary inventions, pushing the boundaries of what is achievable in various fields. From advanced robotics and artificial intelligence to renewable energy solutions and space exploration technologies, your creative potential knows no bounds. With your visionary mind and mastery of scientific principles, you become a catalyst for progress, shaping the future with inventions that were once only dreams.

Cache  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Revolution  
You become a master at technology, you can quickly grasp the principles and applications of any Tinker Specialty you possess.  
You also gain the Tinker equivalent of any powers you purchase, as well as the ability to imbue, channel, and create tinkertech items with your abilities, such as powerful mechas you can control with incredible precision that is specifically tailored to and can utilize your powers. (If you possess Glory Girl’s power you can create a mecha that has her force fields and aura, and if you have Eidolon’s power then you can make an automaton that can gain any 3 powers at a time, etc..)  
Additionally, your Tinker Specialty can obtain permanent slots for your Tinker Powers at a reduced price. You only need to spend one-third of the normal SP cost for T1 Tinker Powers and half of the normal SP cost for T2 Tinker Powers.  
(Tinker) Revolution  
Cost: 30 SP  
You have access to every Tinker technology tree as well as understood technology dating back to the dawn of civilization(s). The closer to understood technology your inventions are the less black-boxed they are. This limit can be raised if you study and analyze your own technology or if a technology you created is reverse engineered and understood by scientists.  
You can have 3 method specializations (modular, efficiency, etc), 5 broad specializations (lasers, waves, code, vehicles, etc.), and 9 narrow specializations (clockwork automata, personal equipment, prosthetics, surveillance, etc.) at once. It takes a minute to switch between specializations.  
Note: Even if you build a replicator the created items will still be black-boxed and need maintenance.  
Note: Technology levels, your base technology level is based at least on 2010 technology and cannot be lower if you are in a world with a more primitive understanding.

Persisting Growth  
Cost: 8 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Time-Loop  
No longer does your Time-Loop carry over only information. It now carries over all personal improvements gained during a loop, no matter the origin.  
*Synchronous Growth*  
Required:Coil  
Both timelines are real and considered "experienced" by Persisting Growth, allowing you to gain all personal improvements from both timelines. For example, if you exercise in one timeline, the other timeline will benefit from it too.   
*Banked Achievements*  
Required:Stacked Move  
Your ability to loop now extends beyond personal improvements. You can carry over up to 10 different achievements into each new loop. These achievements could range from amassing $10 billion, killing a Cape, or even swapping the flag on the Moon for a Mexican one. The key benefit is that you no longer need to repeat these tasks in subsequent loops—they are automatically accomplished.  
The achievements you can bank are limited to tasks where you were the primary contributor or completed the majority of the work. For instance, if you shot Coil with a gun, in the next loop, Coil would simply drop dead with a bullet hole, without you needing to find the gun again. Similarly, if you defeated an Endbringer, you wouldn't need to recreate the conditions necessary to do so again. As long as you did the bulk of the work, such as building the weapon or imbuing it with a Sting-like effect, it will be automatically replicated in future loops.  
Multiple Save Slots  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Time-Loop  
You have five save points instead of one. You can set up an auto-save in one of the slots, by default it will save every day when you go to sleep or at midnight.  
Undo-Redo  
Cost: 8 SP  
Required:Multiple Save Slots  
Instead of having a limited amount of save points, you may revert to any moment in time that you have experienced. It cannot be before you got this power unless you have Homecoming.  
(Thinker) Time-Loop  
Cost: 20 SP  
You can set a save point (in space and time) to which you will return when you die. You can only move the save point forward in time, an initial save point is created when you first gain this power. You can choose to truly die instead of returning. Your memory of past events is slightly enhanced to remember past loops.  
This power creates a real time travel loop as such it has no blind spots and cannot be detected except by other powers that manipulate the timeline.

Archmage  
Cost: 20 SP  
Required: (Trump) Arcanist, (Trump/Tinker) Artificer, (Trump/Tinker) Alchemist, or (Trump) Kineticist  
Arcanist, Kineticist, Artificer, and Alchemist are upgraded to the next level.  
Arcanist gives you access to more magic systems as well as the ability to design your own. Your energy pool and recharge rate are multiplied by 10\. Your spells are no longer limited in strength. Your Kineticist abilities are affected in a similar way.  
Artificer's enchantment cap is raised to five and you generate 6 more charges per day. Your enchantments are no longer limited in strength.  
With Alchemist, you can create potions that can have permanent effects on the drinker. Your potions can now grant powers on par with a high tier cape. You can transmute metamaterials that are more easily enchanted, or that can conduct, store, or enhance spells, as well as various power-like effects. The transmutation time is now proportional to the circle's area instead of the volume.  
With this, you could potentially destroy an Entity if you put your mind to it.  
(This doesn't give you additional abilities, only upgrades what you already have.)  
*Magic Language*  
Required:Ward Master  
Your Ward knowledge is brought to a Archmage level, extending it reaches to Hexes and Boons, Hexes focus on offence, cursing your enemies with misfortune and hindrances, bringing about setbacks and calamities. These dark incantations have a variety of effects, from impairing an opponent's physical and magical abilities to draining their decisions or magical abilities. On the flip side, Boons focus on support, bestowing blessings and advantages upon your allies. These enchantments can enhance their strengths, protect them from harm, heal and empower their abilities, and provide strategic advantages in battles.  
While Wards remain neutral and demand a Ward Stone, Hexes and Boons rely more on a sympathy link, necessitating a symbolic connection between two entities. The stronger the symbolic link, the more seamlessly they can treat as inherently connected, defying the conventional notion that things are separated by mere space.  
*Spirit Language*  
Required:Ward Master  
Required:Lower Dantian  
Your knowledge on wards has now been expanded to include application of chi, granting you the ability to make talismans and formations.  
Talismans are basically strips of paper used to cast spells with chi. Thes can produce a variety of effects such as taking lethal damage, increasing your punching power, or even setting something ablaze with fire. While this is a bit redundant and slower than your actual magic spells, talismans have the advantage of delayed activation, allowing you to set up complex traps with what is effectively a magic trip mine.  
Formations are an array of these talismans being used in conjunction with each other to cover a wider range. These are basically wards made with chi but have the benefit of not setting off a chain reaction if one of them gets destroyed. The formation still stops if one of the talismans is destroyed, it just doesn’t destroy all of them, making it an easier fix. Sadly, the multicomponent nature of formations makes it harder to link multiple formations together, with multiple talismans needed to simply act as routers between just two. It is thankfully much easier to link wards to formations, with a single talisman on the ward stone itself being all that is needed. Though, you might want to do this even if you're just linking wards, as the talismans can act as a layer of protection on the ward stone, being destroyed in its place if something happens.  
*Pill Alchemy*  
Required:(Trump/Tinker) Alchemist  
Required:Lower Dantian  
You gain the ability to use your chi to convert your potions into pills. If used by itself, the most notable benefits will be increasing storage and shelf life. Storage because pills take up less room than potions, with about ten pills taking up as much space in a bottle as one potion, with no loss in efficiency to boot. Shelf life because the transformation into a pill also makes them less vulnerable to loss from getting dropped and foreign elements contaminating their contents. This doesn’t prevent you from mixing potions either, with pills easily dissolving into any other potion you make.  
The interesting part about this comes when you consider the nature of chi. Due to its effect of increasing the user’s health it is possible to reduce or even eliminate Toxicity entirely. This isn’t fool proof; consuming sufficiently powerful potions in rapid succession will generate Toxicity regardless of the amount of chi you use in the conversion process, simply because the body can’t handle that much power at once. You could cheat this by designing a pill whose only effect is to give the user enough chi to overcome the Toxicity, but the effect won’t be instantaneous, meaning they still suffer from the effects until their body recovers. This will take longer in normal people, but those with brute, changer, or any other power that affect their body will have their recovery rate significantly boosted. In theory, someone with a strong enough body power could overcome Toxicity in less than a second with the application of chi. In practice, you’re never going to see it happen unless you happen to convince someone like Alexandria to start popping your pills like crazy. It is inadvisable to attempt this because it makes you sound like a deranged drug dealer asking to be turned into hamburger meat.  
(Trump) Arcanist  
Cost: 15 SP  
You have the ability to cast spells with a variety of magic that can reproduce the effect of non-Tinker powers. While your Shard provides you with a basic library of spells in each system and an intuitive knowledge of them, you will have to research and invent more powerful spells. Your spells will not be stronger than what Eidolon could do in his prime.  
You have a pool of energy to cast spells, you have enough to cast your most powerful spells a dozen times in a short time span. The pool takes 30 minutes to fully recharge. Permanent spells like summons, buffs, and auras reserve part of your reserve while they are active and release the energy when they are canceled or expire.  
(Trump) Kineticist  
Cost: 15 SP  
You have the ability to use psionic techniques that can reproduce the effect of non-Tinker powers. While your Shard provides you with the basics and an intuitive knowledge of how to shape the energy, you will have to research and experiment to produce more powerful results. At most, you will be as strong as Eidolon was in his prime.  
Your pool of energy is enough to use your most powerful techniques a dozen times in a short time span. The pool takes 30 minutes to fully recharge. Permanent effects like constructs, buffs, and auras reserve part of your reserve while they are active and release the energy when they are canceled or expire.  
(Trump/Tinker) Artificer  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can enchant objects with non-Tinker powers by touching them, with a maximum of three enchantments on a single object. You can choose whether the object grants the wielder use of the power, or has a variant of the power itself. This power does not allow creating Variable Trump powers like Eidolon, picking from a fixed set is possible like Othala's power. At their highest, your enchantments will be on the same level as what Eidolon could do in his prime.  
To enchant an object you need a pattern and enough charges to empower the object. Patterns can be researched by tasking your Shard to research a power, this usually takes 6-8 hours per power. You can have up to 3 (5 with negentropy) concurrent research. You gain 12 charges (18 with Negentropy) every day at midnight. Charges do not expire.  
The strength of the power is proportional to the number of charges invested, with the minimum being 3 charges. The efficiency of charges drops by 20% for every 36 charges invested into a single power up to a maximum of 216\. It takes 30 seconds to empower an object regardless of the number of charges used.  
*Administrator's Engineer*  
Required:(Trump) Manager  
You can now place your charges and enchantments into (Trump) Manager’s slots, allowing you to use the abilities directly.  
Likewise, by applying more charges to an ability, you can improve upon it, further refining it. This applies to both abilities derived from enchantments and abilities copied and stolen by others.  
Powers replicated and/or stolen by (Trump) Manager now also have their pattern automatically recorded for replication by (Trump/Tinker) Artificer. Alongside this, you can now also place powers held inside the manager into objects like you would with your enchantments.  
(Trump/Tinker) Alchemist  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can create potions from formulas which will have power-like effects when consumed and the ability to create transmutation circles to change materials into others.  
You have intuitive knowledge of how to develop new formulas. Natural ingredients as well as brewing equipment are required to create the potions. Consuming too many potions in a short amount of time creates Toxicity and can have adverse health effects on the user. The effect of your potions will fade once it's purged from the drinker's blood. Those potions are limited to powers that can be expressed physically such as regeneration, super strength, enhanced senses, invisibility, etc. At their most powerful they will be as strong as a mid-tier cape.  
You have intuitive knowledge of how to create transmutation circles. To perform a transmutation, you need to inscribe the circle on a surface and place the required ingredients inside then touch the circle to activate it. You cannot create materials with power-like properties unless you can study them, this applies to Tinker materials (like alloys). You are not limited in size however the objects must fit within the transmutation circle, at big enough sizes this means taking into account the Earth's curvature. The time to transmute is proportional to the volume.  
*Enchanting Alchemy*  
Required:(Trump/Tinker) Artificer  
You’ve gained the ability to enchant your ingredients, equipment, and/or potions to greatly empower what you can create. The more enchantments, the greater the effects.  
You may use charges to bypass the traditional requirements for the potions you make. A single charge can be used to remove the need for a transmutation circle and can transmute the ingredients for you. Two can be used to create the potions immediately upon having all the necessary ingredients.  
Potions are no longer limited solely to physically expressed powers.  
*Toxic Love*  
Required:(Tinker/Master) Love Potion  
Your mastery of alchemical brews allows you and others to better handle the buildup of Toxicity from potion consumption. When consuming potions of weaker potency, the body absorbs them with minimal to no Toxicity buildup, enabling frequent use without consequence. However, higher-potency potions still create Toxicity at the normal rate. This refined control allows you to experiment and blend weaker potions without risking rapid Toxicity buildup, even during extended use.  
Additionally, you can now create special Detoxifying Elixirs that can actively purge Toxicity from your system when ingested. When used in moderation, they effectively reduce Toxicity buildup, allowing for a reset to potion use. However, over-reliance on these elixirs may cause the body to destabilize, rapidly increasing Toxicity instead, potentially pushing the drinker into dangerous levels without warning.

Siberian  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Master) Manton  
You’ve become an unstoppable force and an immovable object. When moving you can choose to make your body an unstoppable force, capable of punching aside and piercing through any non-absolute defense. You also now have the ability to selectively choose what forces apply to you and to what parts of your body, rendering you immune to non-absolute attacks. As you have no master to project you, you can freely flicker in and out of reality allowing you to effectively teleport short distances and reconstitute yourself in the event your defenses are somehow overcome. You can selectively share these properties for a few minutes at your choice with anything and anyone you touch.  
(Master) Manton  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can create a projection that is a hole in reality, only selectively affected by physical forces and it can extend this effect to anyone and anything it's touching with the exception of yourself. The projection can be in any shape and form you wish, you can alter its form at any time when summoning it.

A Bug's Life  
Cost: 15 SP  
Required: Skitter, or Taylor Anne Hebert  
You can transform and control a massive swarm of bugs that act as a network for their brains; all the brains and nervous systems of your insects are linked together into one connected web, hosting your mind. The swarm can be manipulated to perform various tasks, such as gathering information and attacking enemies. You exist as part of the swarm, able to freely multitask and control every insect independently, allowing them to give orders with precision. When transformed, you will have to designate a select swarm of your bugs as the center of your control radius.  
The size and range of the swarm can vary depending on your skill and the available resources, but it is generally enough to overwhelm most opponents. When transforming, you can transform into any bug you can control.  
You can absorb bugs to heal, and you can even create clones of yourself by having your bugs transform into your body. You can adjust this transformation, no matter what it will be 'you'. For example, you can make them younger or older or grant them smoother skin, but you cannot swap their gender. These clones will not provide an additional control radius.  
*Skittering Life*  
Required:Skittering Legions  
You can now transform into anything you can control. The total volume of all the creatures you transform into at once can be no more than 50% more than your body’s volume.  
Relay Bug  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required: Skitter, or Taylor Anne Hebert  
Each and every one of your bugs under your control acts like a relay, increasing your max range. The further away the bug is from you, the smaller the range each bug gives. At its smallest, you will still be able to control all insects within a 1 meter radius of your controlled insects.  
*Skittering Relay*  
Required:Skittering Legions  
Anything you can control counts as relays.  
Skitter  
Cost: 6 SP  
You have total control of all arthropods within 3 to 5 blocks as well as infinite multitasking.

Hound Of Hell

Their abilities are enhanced, now possessing durability that can withstand sniper rounds, strength that can rip through Tungsten, speed rivalling racing cars, regeneration that can let them heal missing limbs in minutes, senses that enable them to track prey across the city, sharp claws that can shred ordinary materials, and a sonic roar strong enough to disorient or confuse foes. Their intellect is also improved, making them more formidable. Furthermore, any dog that you empower will recognize you as their alpha, developing intense loyalty towards you.

Bitch
