Your Escalation now also affects all your other powers and your specific defenses, getting hit with poison will give you a poison resistance which will then begin to escalate with you, the power will also begin to very slowly lift your other powers' weaknesses, with this rate of improvement will be accelerated if those weaknesses are specifically targeted during combat.

You permanently gain 10% of the power you had during the height of your most recent escalation after you return to your base state, this 10% is counted for each stat/power individually, this also means that every transformation/escalation will give you an increase in overall power no matter how small.

### Tier 3

(Mover/Shaker) Displacement  
Cost: 30 SP  
You have become the quintessential example of what is often called a ‘Blink’ Mover, a sub-classification centred solely around teleportation, thanks to your shard’s focus on the shifting and transportation of space.  
You can employ two distinct types of spatial teleportation. The first is a two-way ‘swapping’ teleportation in which two areas, along with any matter and energy within, are switched in location. The second is one-way teleportation; this effectively erases any matter and energy in the receiving area, replacing it with the incoming space, while creating a vacuum in the original location. For example, you could teleport away a section of air, leaving a vacuum, with that section of air then erasing and overlaying anything at the destination.  
This power has no specific range limitations, aside from standard shard constraints, allowing you to remotely teleport space around the world and even across dimensions. You do, however, have a limited total spatial volume of what you can teleport at once, equivalent to that of a sphere 1 km in radius. Within this limit, you can freely decide the dimensions of the space you wish to teleport and can teleport numerous separate areas simultaneously, though you are limited by your multitasking and overall maximum volume.  
This power is not Manton Limited and acts as an All-or-Nothing effect, capable of spatially cutting matter on an atomic level. While it can affect Endbringer flesh, Endbringer cores remain immune due to their safeguards and spatial warping properties. This power automatically accounts and compensates for factors like momentum, planetary rotational velocity, energy transfer etc.  
To aid in its use, you possess a secondary thinker ability that grants you conscious spatial awareness of everything in the area that you want to teleport from as well as the area that you wish to teleport to, though you need a clear mental image of both locations involved. This clairvoyant sense can even remotely scout out areas you have a clear awareness of. Finally, this ability also provides excellent innate finesse; fine enough that you can teleport complex 3-dimensional shapes, like cutting out a keyhole from a wall.  
*Chronal Displacement*  
Required:Epoch  
The spatial-temporal aspects of Epoch’s power — such as transporting objects to their positions up to ten seconds from the past or future and temporarily freezing them — have seamlessly integrated. You can now employ these more time-oriented spatial manipulations with the same range, volumetric area and precision as (Mover/Shaker) Displacement, significantly expanding your versatility.  
For example, you could teleport huge droves of enemies back to their positions from 10 seconds earlier or, to avoid imminent attacks, remotely teleport them to where they will be located up to 10 seconds in the future. You can also temporarily freeze vast sections of space at will, up to that of your maximum volume and ten second time limit. Do note that maintaining this stasis is a continuous use of your total spatial volume capacity.  
*Dimensional Trekker*  
Required:(Shaker/Mover) Dimension Tripper  
Your spatial and dimensional manipulation powers have merged into a cohesive whole. With (Shaker/Mover) Dimension Tripper, you can now transport large sections of space you are aware of from halfway across the world into dimensions and universes of your design.  
This ability also works in reverse, enabling you to teleport sections from your dimensions into the current universe. For example, you could teleport a region of space from a dimension where gravity is 100 times stronger or the ground is diamond. Be mindful, however, that areas of space from dimensions significantly different from the universe it is in will dissipate as the universe reasserts itself. The greater the divergence in fundamental laws, the faster the dissipation.

To complement this, your control over your teleported spaces has improved. You can "phase" these spaces, regulating how "real" they are within the current universe and preventing them from fully overlapping existing matter. This enables you to precisely manage interactions between the two overlapping spaces, ensuring only the desired effects manifest.  
For instance, you could phase a dimension where machinery does not function over enemy tech. You can also use this to purposely hold areas from other dimensions out of sync to prevent dissipation. Note that maintaining this "phasing" requires continuous mental focus.

(Stranger/Breaker) Informatio  
Cost: 40 SP  
You are attuned to the essence of information—no, more than that, you are information incarnate. Every byte, every whispered word, every pixel in an image that pertains to you forms a vast network, a web of existence you navigate with ease. You live within these threads, making homes out of the records and memories of your existence. Your awareness extends to the whispers of your name, the trace of your image, and the mere idea of you. The essence of who you are resides in the data scattered throughout the world, and this makes you more than a mere being—you are a living, breathing entity woven into the very fabric of knowledge itself.  
Your understanding of the world comes from the information it holds. When it concerns you directly, you possess complete and intimate knowledge—nothing is hidden, nothing is obscure. A mention in a conversation, a line in a database, a photograph on a screen, or a memory in someone’s mind—all these are extensions of yourself. If someone mentions you, you feel it like a vibration in the web that makes up your consciousness. Their words become another anchor point, another node in the expansive network of your existence.  
The extent of your awareness is more nuanced than mere omniscience. While you have a complete understanding of information directly tied to you, your sense stretches beyond to include anything tangentially related. If you are blonde, you gain a faint, yet undeniable, awareness of every other blonde individual in the world. Their lives do not unfurl before you as an open book, but their presence is a hum, a flicker in your perception. It’s like standing in a crowded room where only certain voices rise above the din—you hear their whispers, sense their existence, but the details are vague unless you focus your attention. You are bound by threads that extend beyond the self, connecting to the broader world in a web of faintly glowing lines.  
This power allows you to move through these connections, appearing anywhere where information about you resides. A rumor passed between lips, a photograph pinned to a wall, a digital footprint in a remote server—each of these points becomes a doorway. You do not travel through space as others do; instead, you fold reality along the lines of information. Where your name is thought of or your likeness is stored, you may manifest, a living ghost moving through the data streams of the world. To those who witness such appearances, it is as though you slip through the cracks of reality, emerging from the shadow of a mention or the reflection of a thought.

Beyond movement, you wield the power to manipulate the very essence of information. Information itself is malleable to you, like a sculptor shaping clay. You can destroy it, leaving a void where it once was. When you choose to destroy information, you can induce a Stranger effect, erasing the traces of that knowledge from reality. People forget details, files become corrupted, memories fade. The information is removed, however this doesn’t change what already happened, simple altering known history to make it that whenever information you destroyed never existed. The absence you create is more than a hole in memory; it is a shifts to accommodate the new narrative you impose. It’s important to note that you do not warp Information in the sense of altering history itself; rather, you manipulate the knowledge and memories of others, subtly adjusting their perceptions so that they align with the narrative you create.

Your nature as living information means you are not bound by a singular identity. You can graft new information into your very being, shaping yourself according to the knowledge you possess. If you decide to adopt the information that you are a ginger, then you gain the same semi-awareness of all gingers as if this trait had always been yours. Your awareness extends to those who share that characteristic, creating a faint hum in your perception of every ginger person in existence. In the same way, you can graft other aspects—traits, experiences, skills, even entire histories—transforming yourself with each new piece of information you integrate.  
However, you are limited by the physical reality you inhabit. You cannot hold contradictory truths within yourself simultaneously; if you are currently a ginger, you cannot also be blonde at the same time. But this limitation doesn’t bind you entirely. Instead of discarding contradictions, you store them within a mental vault, like files archived for later use. You can switch between these traits, activating or deactivating them as needed. If a situation requires you to adopt a different appearance or characteristic, you can draw upon the stored information, effectively rewriting your own existence. To the outside world, this change is seamless—people perceive you as if you had always been this way, with reality subtly adjusting around the new narrative.  
This means that while your external appearance or traits may shift, others will not notice any inconsistency. They will remember you as a blonde if that is what you choose to be, even if you had been a ginger the moment before. Photographs, memories, even written records will warp to align with your current state, ensuring a complete integration into the fabric of reality. You can shift from being a seasoned warrior to a charming socialite, and the world will remember you accordingly. It’s as if the very history around you is rewritten to match your current self, smoothing over any discrepancies.

Your ability to graft information is not limited to physical traits. Skills, experiences, and even personal relationships can be absorbed into your being, becoming a part of your new self. You could integrate the combat techniques of a master martial artist, the scientific knowledge of a renowned researcher, or the memories of a seasoned traveler. These aspects become part of your identity until you choose to store them away, allowing you to seamlessly adapt to different roles and challenges. When you assume the knowledge or skills of another, it feels as though you’ve always possessed them, your body moving with the instinctual ease of long-practiced motions.  
You have no fixed form, no unchanging nature. Instead, you are defined by the sum of the information you have chosen to integrate, and the echoes of all the selves you have stored. This makes you as fluid and adaptable as the information that defines you, always changing, always evolving, yet anchored in the awareness of every aspect that has ever been part of your existence.  
In a sense, you are both a storyteller and the story itself—reshaping the narrative of who you are and what you can be, bending reality to match your chosen role. Those who encounter you might think they know you, but that knowledge is always subject to change, always malleable. You walk through the world as a living enigma, a presence that is both ever-shifting and eternally present, defined by the information you hold and the secrets you choose to become.

(Master/Trump) Endbringer Engine  
Cost: 40 SP  
To the inhabitants of Earth Bet, you have been given perhaps the most terrifying power to exist, the one power to create Endbringers.  
However, while you possess the power to create Endbringers, the power is not quite as potent as its most notable user.  
Thus, you have been given the ability to create completely loyal monsters that start off weaker than their brothers and sisters. Each Endbringer you create will start off with a core and enough spatial and dimensional folding energy to create the standard folding spatial flesh that all Endbringers use to protect their cores.  
These weaker Endbringers will start off with roughly 30 sp worth of power and can handle a couple of strikes from their fully grown brothers and sisters, but not much more.  
They will then improve over time, growing bigger, stronger, and more durable at the rate of roughly 1 sp a month until they are fully grown and can match the strength of Behemoth and Leviathan (roughly 60 sp). You have complete control over the abilities they spawn with and how they will evolve over time.  
A fully grown Endbringer may be given any group of shard-based powers that total to 60sp that is not a power-granting or power-growing ability. Any power selected can be scaled up or down according to its chosen SP, so long as the total of all powers given to an Endbringer does not exceed 60 sp. Esoteric Knowledge allows an Endbringer to be given non-shard-based powers.  
However, the construction of each Endbringer is extremely energy and processing intense, meaning that, while you start with an available slot, only 1 additional (or replacement) Endbringer can be made every month (can be reduced to a week with Negentropy) and only 7 can be alive at the same time. Also, if you spawn too many Endbringers in total without Negentropy, you run the risk of completely depleting your shard.  
*Three Times the Charm*  
Required:(Master) Friendbringers  
Your Friendbringers and Endbringer Engine have fused and increased your number of starting Endbringers to 3 and your total number of Endbringers to 10\.  
*Improved Endbringers*  
Required:Improved Friends  
Due to the fusion between Friendbringer and Endbringer Engine the final strength of your Endbringers is raised to 80SP (however the growth rate is still 1sp per month).  
*Endbringer Cycle*  
Required: (Breaker/Trump) Cronus, (Brute) Typhon, (Changer) The End-Becomer, Hero Killer, City Killer, or Hope Killer  
Your cores' innate ability to empower one another has built upon itself, harmonizing and empowering itself.  
You can now reassign your and your Endbringers' cores as you wish, with each core drastically empowering with the power of the one who possesses it. You can reassign the cores to either yourself or your Endbringers in any combination.  
You may also choose to fuse cores together, tripling the effect per core but likewise reducing the amount of cores they have available and making them more vulnerable.  
*An End To All*  
Required:Advent of the End  
Required:King of the End  
Your ability to summon Endbringers has been further enhanced by the sheer scale of energy you now produce through your cores. Now, not only can you freely transfer cores and energy between your Endbringers but all of your Endbringers are now summoned fully grown.

To make matters worse for your enemies, outside of just fusing with your Endbringers, you can now freely transfer the abilities of your Endbringers between cores (including your own), allowing you to swap abilities between Endbringers and between Endbringers and yourself should their cores still exist.  
Be mindful that fusing cores still produces a tripling of energy production but comes at the cost of reducing the amount of cores that are available and making you and your Endbringers more vulnerable.

(Thinker/Master) Burning Bridges

Through those strings you can doom a connection, you can decide what will be the outcome but not how it will be achieved or you can leave the outcome as random, the outcome could be something like "Being B decides to kill Being A" or "Being A ends their friendship with Being B by destroying their family heirloom", or even "Being B kills Being A fiance and Being A triggers with the power to raise undeads". (Tinker) Clarketech  
Cost: 35 SP

Machines hidden away in pocket dimensions creating holographic interfaces in the air serving as the equivalent to smartphones, zero-point energy-powered flying broomsticks, nanotech-based healing potions, and multidimensional structures are just the tip of the iceberg as you begin making technology that blurs the line between the possible and impossible.  
Negentropy enables you to make use of negentropy in your own Clarketech.  
*Clericus Techno-Magica*  
Required:Yes, Techno-Magica.

There is technology so advanced it is indistinguishable from magic. Then we have magic so analyzed it is simply science. Now we have YOU, a living nightmare for any entity’s cycle. You don't simply use physical and life science as a supplement to magic, you use magic as a supplement to them.  
To turn magic into standard physics and back into magic again is to play God with reality itself. No, let me rephrase that. It is to MAKE Gods and use them as glorified USB sticks. (Trump) Shard Supply Store  
Cost: 40 SP

You can hold onto and use a limited number of these constructed powers at once or grant them to other people.

The construction of Trump powers follows different rules as Shard Supply Store does not directly allow the construction of powers that permanently alter its own rules or permanently connect to, copy, steal, or create other powers as a way to sidestep Shard Supply Store's limited capacity for powers, temporary or limited effects are allowed though. *Abzu*  
Required:(Mover/Shaker) Nexus  
All the shards that make up (Trump) Shard Supply Store are now located in your dimension, giving you access to your own Shardspace. You can directly interact with all of these shards and your shard components now bud, grow and develop like normal shards. When you're using them, they will give significant leeway with your abilities and loosen restrictions. In time, you could grow and develop into something akin to that of an Entity.

(Shaker/Thinker) Be the Butterfly effect\!  
Cost: 30 SP  
At any time, you may enter a completely accurate simulation of the past created by your power; however, there is no past version of you in this simulation. Despite this, your presence is remembered, and any effects you had on the world at that point are maintained. You may choose to simulate any time within the last year. The simulation automatically ends if enough time passes in the simulation to reach the time you created that specific simulation. No time passes in the present while you are in the simulation. You enter this simulation in the past of the location you were at in the present if that space is unoccupied; if it is occupied, you appear in the nearest empty space. You are free to move around to any location in the simulation even across the universe or local multiverse, and if you end the simulation, you appear in the nearest empty space to the location you were at in the simulation. Being killed in the simulation automatically ends it returning you to the present unharmed.  
You may interact with the simulation with your body and powers, with everything and everyone within reacting just as the original would to anything you do. Changes you make to the simulation ripple out and affect the present within a few city blocks of your exit point, as if what you did in the simulation actually happened in the past.  
For example, if you kill or save the life of somebody in the "past", but their body isn’t within a few blocks of your body in the present, then nothing happens to them. This can’t be used to create temporal clones of people, so if you trap someone in a location they would not be at in the present and end the simulation at that location, but the original's body isn’t nearby in the present, then they won’t remember being trapped there or interacting with you at that time, and there won’t be a copy of them at that location.

(Brute/Shaker) Seed of Yggdrasil

(Shaker/Blaster) Fractal of Entropic Decay  
Cost: 35 SP  
You have in your hands the power to control what the Entities have been dreading and try to stave off to escape their inevitable demise against: the phenomenon of Entropy. In their efforts to understand it, they spend copious amounts of time researching this.  
At first, it’s viewed more as bare temperature manipulation, yet that’s further from the truth; it handles the amount of expended or unavailable energy in a system. A system in the physical sense can apply to anything but is best described as a portion of the universe where changes take place in response to a set of conditions or the environment that is then studied. It can be complex, such as a planet, or simple enough to fit in a beaker, as the liquid within a glass.

The “system” thus utilized for this power is an area of three city blocks around the user. This, being Shard-based, is quite limited in scope for the Entities’ concerns about Entropy.  
An inherent part of this ability is an extant Thinker power to perceive energy and levels of energy of any kind or measure. Once the current level of entropy is determined, you can adjust it, resulting in a change in the system. This applies to anything, such as a glass of ice, a room, or a living organism including yourself.  
A quirk of this ability is manifesting itself through a translucent stygian black energy field either as an aura or throughout your “system’s” range and even somewhat a polar opposite to Stilling: ebony rays of unlight. Some applications are somewhat analog to Stilling yet utterly antithetical in basis. Something to mull over…

The power is partitioned into three aspects: Containment, Diffusion, and Exhaustion:  
Containment is the fine control or deceleration of Entropy to a microscopic and macroscopic level, which contains activation energy (minimum amount of energy needed to initiate a reaction), among the chemical and physical phenomena that need energy to function or continue to occur. In turn, you can manipulate Entropy on a system or object to extend its timespan from its inevitable decay, violently disrupt a system’s integrity, and drastically cause system equilibrium by heating or freezing the system (or select parts).  
Diffusion is the middle ground of Entropy, in which you diffuse, absorb, and assimilate energy through macroscopic control of Entropy. This is utilized as diffusing the area’s utilized energy (including the one’s parahuman powers use, effectively negating them), absorbing it to bolster the user’s physical and dynamic abilities, or assimilating the system’s resources in mass for various uses.  
Exhaustion is the Entities’ fear, the only reason they stopped probing it: Entropy Acceleration. This is used to exhaust the system’s energy reserves responsible for structure and form causing its breakdown, destabilizing anything within your range or particular liking, and having physical and radioactive effects. For example, on a smaller scale, you can decay anything from an appliance to a house if you let Exhaustion spread, weaponizing it to an anti-energy exponentially growing through propagation to any matter or energy on contact, or infuse it into a weapon for it to deteriorate anything the weapon damages or simply graze.  
The only glaring weakness of having this power is its anathema: Negentropy. A Negentropic being can compete with you, yet depends on their energy generation/recovery: A negligible energy rate places the odds in your favour while a formidable rate of energy recovery turns this into a battle of attrition in the Negentropic being’s favour.

(Shaker) The Ultimate Question  
Cost: 40 SP  
Your Shard contains information that is simultaneously the most priceless and worthless knowledge the Entities have. A burning desire that despite over millions of years of research, they seem no closer to getting. Your shard contains the record of the closest they have gotten to Negentropy.

The basic theory was that since the Multiverse allows for infinite variation, it should be possible to harness infinite variations of energy. Unfortunately, the act of reaching out into the multiverse was simply too energy-exhausting, meaning that they absorbed less energy than they were expending. This doesn’t mean that this \[Data\] is useless though, it just wasn’t what they were looking for. Ultimately, the information was repurposed to simulate and manipulate this energy for their own ends.  
When using this power, a large 30-centimeter silvery white ring or “halo” will manifest itself around you, affecting things within a three-block radius. By default, it appears behind your head. You can change its location around you and even its size, but it will always manifest in your vicinity. This halo, while antithetical in application, is surprisingly analogous to Stilling in basis—a point of study, perhaps.  
As stated previously, this power can be used in two basic ways known as \[Simulation\] and \[Manipulation\].  
\[Simulation\] applies a constant rate of energy to an object or phenomenon. Originally designed to simulate how the universe’s energy generation works and how to possibly increase it, it has been repurposed to allow things like a bullet ignoring air resistance and gravity to fire in a perfectly straight line. If this sounds familiar, it should. This mechanic has been further refined into what modern Parahumans know as All-or-Nothing. Interestingly, it is possible to affect other Perfect powers within your radius, allowing you to increase their scope or even turn them “OFF,” so to speak.  
\[Manipulation\] is the direct management of potential variations of energy within your area of effect. This is not energy control so much as potential energy manifestation. It transforms the unused potential energy, or zero-point energy, into other possible variations of said energy such as electricity, seemingly making energy from nothing. It also allows you to effortlessly transform one type of energy into another such as kinetic energy into thermal energy. It is also possible to return energy to its zero-point state. An example would be letting a nuclear bomb go off only for the explosion to just disappear without leaving even a trace of radiation. When used like this, the added zero-point energy can be stored by your Shard to use on a later occasion. This potential energy absorption is the core mechanic by which Entities “feed” at the end of a \[Cycle\].  
When using both \[Simulation\] and \[Manipulation\] together, it is possible to use \[Simulation\] as a framework through which to control energy changed by \[Manipulation\]. This allows you to focus the energy into specific directions and even release it outside of your range of control. This is a highly complex process, but you are given a minor thinker power to help manage it all.  
Should you possess genuine Negentropy, this power doesn’t change much. Rather, it becomes dedicated to managing your personal Negentropy, allowing you to finely control its framework and even increase its efficiency when affecting your other powers, enhancing all benefits they may provide.

*Many-Worlds Interpretation*  
Required:(Breaker/Trump) Ignis Fatuus  
Ignis Fatuus ability to “flicker” through realities has revitalized the discarded \[Data\] of reaching out into the multiverse and successfully reformatted it into a more usable form, giving you the new power expression \[Emulation\].  
\[Emulation\] is the management of potential variations of forms of matter. This allows you to change your environment to a different possible environment. You could be standing in a city only to “flicker” it into the desert; it could have been in a different reality. It is also possible to only target specific objects such as turning a rusty knife into a laser blade.  
The direct manipulation of matter is possible when used in conjunction with both \[Simulation\] and \[Emulation\]. This allows you to optimize changes made to the environment to your favour, such as providing cover from attacks outside your range.  
*Wave Function Collapse*  
Required:(Breaker/Trump) Ignis Fatuus  
Required:The Gibborim Knight  
The power of \[Emulation\] has expanded in scope, allowing you to combine multiple different versions of reality into one. This layering also benefits Ignis Fatuus as it allows you to combine different versions of yourself into a single version of you. This will be version of you will possess all the powers of the different versions of yourself and can even possess fusions of the powers depending on compatibility. However, fusing too many versions of yourself will be taxing on your shard.  
An additional function has also been unlocked, \[Annihilation\]. This is process is done by combining \[Simulation\], \[Manipulation\], and \[Emulation\] all at once to cause combining realities to mutually destroy each other and turn into zero-point energy for your Shard. As you might have guessed, this is the specific mechanic by which Entities “feed” at the end of each \[Cycle\]. Performing this function, while efficient at small scales, becomes very energy dependent at larger ones. This only applies to the start-up process, which is why entities can apply it on a universal scale and still receive a generous amount of energy, but a single shard will simply die trying. A better example would be jumpstarting a full tank portable generator with a car battery versus trying to jumpstart it with a single AA battery.  
That doesn’t mean you don’t have uses for it, however. Your thinker ability has combined with your ability to see representations of other’s powers to allow you to use this function in a defensive manner. Using the images provided as a basis, you can determine what possible action that your opponent is doing, target a reality where this action was successful, and purposefully destroy it, causing that specific action to fail. This is effectively a hard counter to powers such as Path to Victory due to you physically destroying the path they are using. It is possible for them to bait you into destroying a path that they aren’t going to use, but this requires them to manually decide to abandon said path since until it is destroyed, their shard will still determine it to be the best path.

(Tinker/Trump) Shards  
Cost: 40 SP  
You are a Tinker specialized in manipulating Shards, which allows for personal Shard editing/refining/researching and \[Data\] gain from nearby Shards.  
\[Data\] gathering takes active combat with a Shardbearer to process and copy \[Data\], allowing your Shard to gain these powers or offshoots. You can cannibalize different \[Data\] to strengthen or weaken different powers, adjusting them with your Raw \[Data\] and \[Resources\].  
You gain both passive Raw \[Data\] Acclimation, which accelerates depending on how much \[Data\] you have in your Shard (you can code and edit sweeping changes, on a much larger scale, with a more effective ability creation and incorporation, with a speedier pace depending on your \[Data\]’s quantity and variety you’ve copied from other Shards) and a passive \[Energy\] gain from, both from researching energy-efficient (energy-rich) methods and passively editing your Shard to implement this improvements, which will increase your Shard's lifespan if left unused.  
At the same time, your Shard can be overtaxed if intensively utilized until it breaks in terms of raw \[Energy\] usage, though you will be warned. Having Negentropy will mitigate this risk, based on adding better methods of \[Energy\] usage, production, and allocation.  
If offered direct access to inert Shards e.g. The Garden of Eden, you’ll freely manipulate these Shards with a touch, interfacing with them, plus a significant \[Energy\] expenditure, discover the methods of Shard Construction, and make powers from them, this analysis taking 72 hours of direct contact (with Negentropy or Shardless making this moot, bypassing this condition).  
Shard Construction (by extension Power Creation’s) requirements will take up an incredible amount of Raw \[Data\] and \[Energy\] to assemble, configure, set up, and finally fine-tune up to your task, enough you take the serious risk of immediate Shard Death due to how \[Data\] and \[Energy\]-intensive it is (Negentropy neutralizes this risk, though). The Raw \[Data\] necessary for Shard Construction is about a year's worth of \[Data\] generation (equal to 20 fully \[Data\] replicated Shards worth for a full year as well left unused), with the Raw \[Data\] needed for Power Configuration being variable based on the Shard’s resulting specialization in question.  
Multi-Shard Interface  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Tinker/Trump) Shards  
Your ability to tinker with your own Shard(s) has been expanded to tinker with the Shards of others you are physically touching as well. As a result you can theoretically radically change how a given Shard works and thus the power it generates.  
However, this is not without a cost, as Shards are unlikely to change without cause meaning you have to negotiate with a Shard each time you change it. As a result, expanding a Shard ability costs \[Data\] which will allow you to change the configuration of a Shard without increasing its SP cost. The larger changes you make, especially those not along the lines of a Shard’s core purpose, the larger expenditure of \[Data\] you have to make.  
Furthermore, a Shard is more than just the code it runs, meaning that as you increase the power of the Shard you will also need to improve the hardware the Shard runs on. Thus increasing a Shard’s strength (and thus its power's SP cost) will cost \[Energy\], and significantly more \[Energy\] as the strength of the Shard increases. Moreover, since \[Energy\] is only passively generated over time the increase in required \[Energy\] translates to an increase in required wait time between improvements. This can be shortened by dedicating \[Data\] and \[Energy\] to researching more energy-efficient power generation methods, but even this is a product of diminishing returns. Negentropy significantly reduces the wait time between changes and removes the risk of burning out your Shard from too much energy usage.  
To make matters worse, you also need to consider a Shard’s rank. As you increase the rank of a Shard you also need to increase its size, which is done by feeding it \[Construction\] which can only be generated by the Shard Construction method. Thus increasing the rank of a Shard is equivalent to constructing many inert Shards and feeding them to the already active Shard and thus takes just as many \[Resources\] in both \[Data\] and \[Energy\].

(Shaker/Stranger) Retroactive Change  
Cost: 25 SP  
You can retroactively alter events up to 3 months into the past, with the extent of the change directly affecting the level of “pushback” you will experience. Pushback causes details of your change to become blurry and beyond your control, introducing random elements that fit with the alterations you made. The more significant the alteration, the more unpredictable these details will become. The more changes made to the environment and people related to the change, the greater the pushback you will experience. Additionally, pushback increases with the number of people aware of the original timeline, as their collective knowledge creates resistance to the change. If there are more than a thousand people aware of the original timeline, then alteration is practically impossible.

When you alter the past, the new version of events replaces the knowledge related to the original timeline for most individuals. However, certain Thinker powers can resist this alteration, allowing their users to retain information from the original timeline. Some powers may even grant the ability to perceive what the timeline was before the change, providing insight into both versions of events.  
The changes must meet these requirements: they must make sense and be possible within the context of the timeline. Additionally, you cannot add new information into people’s minds; you can only replace existing memories. This limitation prevents you from affecting the past of individuals unrelated to the event you are changing.

For example, you can prevent a catastrophic industrial accident from two months ago by ensuring a faulty safety valve is replaced a week before the event. However, pushback causes a minor attack on the facility. People directly involved retain their memories of the changes and those who would have died in the event are now alive, with the person who triggered never triggering here.

Technology is the aspect of progression and adaptation; able to be improved on countless times; but it is static if nothing advances it, it will stagnate and rust.  
But you? You, my good friend, are the singularity in both fields. You specialize in techno-organic or Bio-mechatronics, deleting the boundaries between hard and wetware to create something better than the sum of its parts. From a set of power armor that can be fused and stored within one's body granting increased protection to access to advanced weapons and digital systems. Creating modules that absorb other unclaimed tech and adapting to a system. Devices that can regenerate or even T.O.-nanites that can think and make quick adjustments faster than an average nanite could. Produce advanced T.O.-ware that can grant someone advanced nano-netics with nothing but a simple pill or shot maybe even a way to transfer one's consciousness perfectly with no error after enough study. Beasts of all shapes and sizes can be made, all outfitted with technology weaponry integrated in them so deeply their descendants will have their modifications. The sky's the limit and nothing can hold you back.

The actual diamond itself is needed, not a similar stone or even an atomically perfect replica, as there is always a crucial component that facilitates the enormous power of these superweapons. However, the accuracy of the outcome decreases the further in time you go, due to the increasing variables of possibilities. Within the first 10 minutes, you maintain nearly 99% accuracy in achieving your intentions. In combat, your actions become unpredictable and unstoppable. You can fire a gun, and by inverting cause and effect, the bullets appear to have already hit the target before you even pull the trigger. As with everyday tasks, your accuracy diminishes as you approach the 30-minute limit.

So you can't just grab some obscure artefact from a forgotten book and expect it to work. But you can use Harry Potter's invisibility cloak or Doctor Who's psychic paper with no problem.

(Brute/Trump) Anu  
Cost: 25 SP  
Your power is a conceptual fusion of both Lung and Eidolon. That is to say, your power continually ramps up through raging conflict which grants you new temporary powers. Then again, it isn't to say you can surely exploit it with nothing as even outside of combat your baseline grants you a low-level Alexandria package comparable to Glory Girl’s alongside an additional low-level blaster power in similar potency to Lady Photon.  
As your power ramps up, your baseline continuously grows next to your invulnerability branching out from general durability and adaptively developing immunities to the parahuman effects you’re battling against or alongside, your Brute and Blaster powers will similarly gain an adaptive diversity to be more formidable against powers you are contending on the fight’s both sides for any eventuality, while your flight speed continuously increases, your mind simultaneously improving to perceive and function at your constantly dashing speed and growth rate.  
During this escalation, you’ll temporarily develop powers meant to aid you amidst your battles. Depending on the circumstance, these powers can fluctuate from solely meant for combat i.e. a striker power meant to disintegrate what you touch, to utility-based powers i.e. a Thinker power focusing on target location. The powers’ growth rate is naturally equivalent to your baseline powers, though developing new powers will delay your growth rate.  
Finally, you can affect your growth rate. Like Lung, you are capable of charging up in anticipation of a fight to accelerate your ramping up, yet, unlike Lung, you are fully capable of beginning to ramp up outside of battle, although it would be extremely slow on top of only capable of reaching a mid-level Brute and Blaster for your baseline. Additionally, this control over your growth rises in effectiveness in combat, being able to “steer” it in certain directions e.g. from focusing on escalating your invulnerability to directing it to develop a new power to assist you.

Required: (Trump) Queen of Escalation

#### Stranger

(Stranger/Shaker) Sensorium  
Cost: 15 SP  
You are capable of producing an invisible, intangible “fog” over a large area. This fog is capable of hijacking the senses of everything inside, living or artificial (like cameras and microphones), giving you the ability to access and override them at will to make them experience whatever illusions you desire, effectively turning the area into a holodeck. You are also capable of creating illusions of the same calibre that can be visible even to people outside the fog, although you will not get to access their senses or be capable of specialising the illusions to specific people like you would if they were inside.  
You can range from giving everyone in the fog the same illusion to giving each individual person a different personalised experience, with their expectations and knowledge filling in the gaps for any details about the illusions you don't personally assign (how it breaks, what it looks like on the back, etc.).  
Those inside the fog will instinctively act in such a way to maintain the illusions they’re observing (i.e. if they lean against an illusory wall they will unconsciously lean in such a way that they are still balanced and thus won't fall through it), if they push past these instincts and/or make mistakes the illusions automatically adjust to maintain realism and explain away any inconsistencies caused by the illusion in whatever way the subject thinks would make the most sense (i.e. if they tripped and fell through an illusory wall then the illusory wall will have “broken”).  
Your power is even capable of hijacking and tricking exotic senses like thinker powers, although they take more focus to understand and manipulate.

(Stranger/Master) Absolution  
Cost: 10 SP  
You possess the uncanny power to ensure that no matter what you do, you will always be forgiven for your actions by the individuals affected. Whenever you do something that would cause offence, resentment or hostility in any form, the people impacted will automatically, completely forgive you for whatever you did.  
For example, you could verbally harass or even directly harm someone and they would absolve you. This doesn’t alter or erase an individual’s memories, it only ensures that they will not form a grudge or hold whatever you’ve done against you. This power will cause those affected to subconsciously justify or rationalise your actions, convincing themselves that your behaviour wasn’t that bad or that there was a good reason for it, but only to the point of indifference.  
*You ARE the Messiah\!*

Spit in someone’s eye? A blessing bestowed from the almighty. Stab a family member in the heart? A feat to be worshipped and clear proof of divinity. These rationalisations are so ingrained and seemingly logical that it is extremely challenging to convince an affected individual otherwise.

You gain the power to cultivate.  
This can be applied to plants, as well as animals and people. You can cultivate specific traits and abilities in others or even yourself, encouraging and directing development in any biological system. While you don't have full control, your ability makes a significant impact, especially when your target is younger, thus more flexible to change. However, the rate of growth lowers over time and as the target ages. Cultivation isn't immediate, usually requiring weeks to months to develop a specific trait. The more specific the trait, the faster you can develop it.  
Few examples of your capabilities are cultivating traits such as Confidence, Leadership, and Willpower, or boosting your target's biological attributes like Strength, Speed and Endurance to greatly surpass human limits. You can also use this power on yourself.

(Trump) Hyperfocused  
Cost: 10 SP  
You can now choose to temporarily weaken one or more of your other powers to redistribute its strength out to any number of different powers, being able to choose roughly how much strength to take and give to/from each ability of yours.  
The amount that one power boosts another is based upon the overall relative strength of the powers: Gifting 100% of a T0 power's strength to a paragon power would result in a nigh unnoticeable increase; while gifting even 1% of a paragon power to a T0 would result in an incredible boost.  
The boost works based upon the power's concept, focusing on improving based upon emphasising its themes and strengths. If a pyrokinetic power is focused on the high intensity of its fire, most of the boost will go towards increasing that intensity further; if a Master power is focused on its range and control of many minions, then this power would focus on improving that range and, if it's control is already absolute, potentially even introducing thematically related ways to allow you to capture/create more minions; etc.

#### Thinker

(Thinker/Master) Self Image  
Cost: 15 SP  
Any image of yourself—whether it's a drawing, photograph, statue, reflection, or any other representation—is connected to you. You have the ability to perceive through these images and even transform them into physical manifestations of yourself. The closer the image resembles you in detail and accuracy, the less effort it requires to convert it into a fully functional clone. For example, a life-sized statue of yourself can easily be animated into what is essentially a perfect replica, with minimal strain and limitation. On the other hand, a simple printed photograph of you would be more challenging to transform into a clone, requiring greater effort and potentially resulting in a less stable copy.

These clones all have your powers, acting as extensions of your will. If your original body were to be destroyed, your consciousness would automatically transfer to one of your existing images, allowing you to survive as long as any depiction of you remains. Through these clones, you can continue to interact with the world, effectively making you immortal as long as there are images of you in existence.

As with any problem or "broken" thing, it takes time and dedication for you to find a solution, with the problem's scale and reach proportional to the time you take to solve and "fix" it.  
   
(Thinker) Weakspot  
Cost: 10 SP  
You know the weakness of anyone or anything you see. You don't necessarily know how to leverage that weakness, though. For example, when looking at Alexandria you'll see that she's vulnerable to drowning, but won't know how to actually drown her.  
*Critical Weakspot\!*  
Required:(Striker/Trump) Critical Hit\!  
Landing an attack on a physical weak spot will now be a guaranteed crit. You have a 77% chance to do double damage, 10% for triple, 8% to quadruple, and 5% to do 10 times.  
*Heart Playstyle*  
Required:(Thinker) Parry  
Required:(Thinker) Your Only Move  
You know where they bleed the most, now. Your counter-defensive and counter-offensive Thinker powers fuel your awareness, once more: you grasp your opponent's weak points, deficiencies on their footing, fighting style, the environment's weak links, and how to leverage it in 1.5 seconds without any loss in traction.

(Thinker) Filter  
Cost: 9 SP  
You can create filters to see the world through. In practice what this does is it allows you to assign visual filters, which are expressed as colours that can manifest in any multitude of ways. The filters can be for anything you can imagine and can be altered at any time.

Filter for “danger” and assign it with the color red, and you’d soon start to notice a clearly visible, only to you, sign on anything that could be a danger to you.  
Smoky trails into rooms that foreshadow danger, a stock's ticker is soft red before you buy it, a random person on the street is flashing in bright red warning you of a killer in plain clothes etc.

Likewise you can also assign things such as “success” to the color green, numbers highlighted in green as you fill out a lottery ticket, a smoky trail leading somewhere, the correct wire to defuse a bomb highlighting as a bright and unmistakable neon green.  
The more vivid the colors, the closer to your assigned filter it matches. Despite however many filters you assign or however you choose to manifest it, it’ll never actually deter your normal vision, still being fully aware of what your normal visual input would show. You can assign as many filters as you want, as broad or specific as you want, and can reassign colors and how that manifests at will.

(Thinker) My Eyes are Your Eyes  
Cost: 9 SP  
By touching someone you can permanently use any of their senses, including Parahuman senses.  
This works on animals, humans, Parahumans, Endbringers, and Entities.

[(Thinker) Danger Sense](#bookmark=id.5yq109f8mko2)

(Thinker) Discombobulate  
Cost: 9 SP  
You possess unparalleled precision in your actions. Every movement you execute goes precisely where it is intended, with the ideal amount of force required for the task. You possess an innate understanding and control of your bodily functions and operations, including every autonomic function, like your organs (heart, liver, and intestine), individual muscle fibres, hormonal production and regulation, and mental and neural processes, with absolute precision.

[(Thinker) Past Sight](#bookmark=id.bcjv2nf001qw)

[(Thinker) Twisted World](#bookmark=id.75z6ifktz2vn)

(Thinker) Schrodinger  
Cost: 7 SP  
You can see five visions that start the moment you begin the vision to five minutes later, each with a different choice you choose before starting the vision, and can choose which route you wish to take. You cannot use this power in the visions, and you have to choose one of the routes. You can end a vision early. If you encounter a blindspot you'll snap out of your visions and you'll be where you started.

(Thinker) Anti Monitor  
Cost: 7 SP  
You know when you're being directly observed and can counter-observe the target. If they are listening in on you, you can listen in on them. If they are using power, you can counter-observe them as well.

(Thinker) Snap  
Cost: 7 SP  
With a single glance you can tell all of a person's mental and emotional weak points. This doesn't help you leverage them.  
*Flaws of Creation*  
Required:(Thinker) Weakspot  
You can see more than just emotional and mental weak points, you can see physical weak points as well. With but a glance you know just where to strike to cause maximum physical damage to your target, seeing all the imperfections and flaws which can be leveraged to destroy all that you desire.  
Furthermore, you are no longer restricted to seeing the weak points of living beings, your gaze can unveil the flaws of inanimate objects as well, such as revealing just where to strike to bring a building collapsing down.

(Thinker) Landlord  
Cost: 7 SP  
Anyone within a 50 feet radius will be known. This can range from armed intruders to Strangers, within your range, you can spot them and know the exact details of what they have on them. You can also attach your power to an object or building and sense whenever someone tries to get inside even if you're not there.

(Thinker/Brute) Transferable Skills  
Cost: 6 SP  
The ability to adapt your skills from one field to another is among the most valuable talents a person can have, a talent you have in spades it seems.  
What this power offers is three fold. First and perhaps the most immediately apparent, is that all your skills will grow to match the greatest among your repertoire. Moreover any improvements to your skill in any skill will also improve your skill amongst every other field. This applies for every skill you try your hand at.  
If you had been a world renowned chef you could pick up a gun and land a bullseye on a standard target as easy as it would be to dice some onions, even if you had never picked up a gun before.  
An expert video gamer who’s never bothered to run would find himself capable of scaling up a building like he’d been practicing parkour his entire life.  
The second effect is more passive, your mind immediately learning to adapt existing skills to improve one another across any field.  
As the third effect, you’ve gained the power to shift your body’s physical form to reflect different skill sets. The physical body can only adapt to the level of the skill set you are utilizing. You can freely shift back to your normal form at will, you’ll retain your level of skill however your performance may suffer as your body is not at the optimal level to perform alongside your skill.

(Thinker) Tracker  
Cost: 7 SP  
Provided you either know what something or someone looks like or can get an accurate description or name, you can immediately pinpoint where it is and can figure out the quickest and/or easiest way to get there.

[(Thinker) Precognitive Combat](#bookmark=id.qle1nfp7a9mi)

(Thinker) Sympathetic Sight  
Cost: 5 SP  
You can get information on anything (living or nonliving) by viewing replicas of it. The more accurate a replica is, the greater amount of detail you can get about the object it represents.

View a crude drawing of a building, and you can get the knowledge that the building it represents still exists and the rough cardinal direction it’s in; view a map of an area and you can get a top-down view of the area the map represents and where it exists relative to you; view a to-scale doll of a person (or one made using parts from the person) and you can not only get an accurate third person view of the target and can pinpoint their current location exactly, but you can also get extra insight into them like how they think or their emotional weaknesses, depending on what qualities the doll gets most accurate.  
*Full Profile*  
Required:(Thinker) Full Picture  
Now, if you manage to capture an object in any of your senses, you can push to allow you to sense that thing with all your senses along the entire object, even airtight cavities. Overusing this feature can give you Thinker headaches.

(Thinker) Full Picture  
Cost: 5 SP  
All your senses work in an “absolute” fashion: if you perceive something, no matter how occluded or how minute a part of it, you will be able to perceive it in its entirety with that sense as if you were right next to it. This is a full 3D extension of the sense along its topology, including internal topology if the object is not airtight. This doesn't give you knowledge of things resting on or inside the object, just the object itself. This has no range limit, allowing you to view even heavenly bodies light-years away in full, real time detail.  
For example, if you saw only a person's foot, you’d be able to view that person in their entirety; if you heard a muffled conversation, you’d be able to hear the words loud and clear; if you touched a bottle, you could feel the entire surface of the bottle, including its inner walls; etc.  
As well as this, you can also do the opposite, filtering specific objects out of your senses if you desire, leaving only a vague “blob” in its place that you know is filtered. So you could filter out a specific person's voice to ignore them; or, with quick reflexes, filter out a flashbang grenade to avoid being affected by it; etc.  
This power does innately help you process your senses to prevent you from getting sensory overload, but that protection breaks down if this power is pointed against particularly large (building sized) or complex (Escher-like/fractal) objects, giving Thinker headaches without training and focus.  
*Ignorance Is Bliss*  
Required:(Thinker) Danger Sense  
Your power will automatically filter out dangerous sensory inputs, rendering you immune to threats such as flashbangs and cognitohazards.

[(Thinker) Roleplay](#bookmark=id.89gf2ajkez4w)

[(Thinker) Looking for More](#bookmark=id.eawf3gy5dws4)

(Thinker) One or the Other  
Cost: 5 SP  
You can correctly answer any question that is yes/no, true/false, or a/b and more than 100 people know the correct answer to it on the planet. You also know if the answer leans heavily in one direction or the other.

[(Thinker) Pattern Recognition](#bookmark=id.la5zsx9gbxdf)

(Thinker) Scrying Orb  
Cost: 4 SP  
You can create a floating, intangible orb that you can use to gather information from afar. You can move the orb telekinetically, and may perceive things from the orb's location with all your senses as if you were there. It cannot go through living things, and intense heat dispels it. While not invisible, the orb is very faint and hard to see, being highly transparent and lacking specific color.  
Divine Gaze  
Cost: 2 SP  
Required:(Thinker) Scrying Orb  
Instead of creating a scrying orb, you may "cast" your gaze at any location, including those you have never been to before. This allows you to use all of your senses, including supernatural ones, at that location.  
Your gaze has two modes. One is completely silent and undetectable, allowing you to watch locations or stalk people with nobody noticing. The other creates an invisible, intangible pressure at the location of your gaze, making people aware they are being watched. This pressure is strong but non-lethal. You can freely toggle between the two modes.

(Thinker) Perfect Timing  
Cost: 4 SP  
You gain enhanced timing. You can effectively time and manage group activities with exceptional efficiency. With this ability, you can calculate the precise amount of time required for a given task and organize team members accordingly. Your enhanced timing ability requires you to have an understanding of every factor involved in the task at hand. Whether it's the environment, fitness, parahuman powers, or any other relevant detail, you have a heightened sense of intuition that helps you precisely determine the optimal course of action for each situation. You have the normal shard Blindspots.

(Thinker) Enhanced Senses  
Cost: 3 SP  
Each of your senses becomes enhanced. Your nose can sense electromagnetic fields; your mouth can understand chemical composition; your touch can examine structural layout; your ears can use echolocation; and you may see from any pore of your skin.  
You additionally become immune to information overload, and may selectively disable any part of your senses.  
*Analyze*  
Required:Thinker (Understanding)  
Not only are you able to sense chemical composition and structural layout, but you gain the understanding of how anything you analyze works, allowing you to replicate it. This does not apply to tinker-tech or supernatural effects.  
*Universal Vision*  
Required:Micro and Tele  
Your ability to see as far as you want applies to your skin-vision, granting LOS across the entire universe.  
Shard blindspots still apply.

(Thinker) Dr Dolittle  
Cost: 3 SP  
You have the ability to communicate with and understand animals. From mammals to birds, reptiles to amphibians, you can easily connect with any animal you encounter, albeit some require more effort than others. With some animals, such as insects, their alien mindset and manner of communication make it challenging to fully comprehend, but talking to a hive rather than a single bug can make it easier.  
(Do note that humans count as animals, thus allowing you to bypass language barriers.)  
*Aura of a Disney Princess*  
Required:Master (Animals)  
All animals are irresistibly drawn to you, treating you with devotion and loyalty. Whether it’s a playful squirrel, a majestic eagle, or a gentle deer, they all love you and instinctively come to your aid, often before you even realize you need help. Birds serenade you with sweet melodies, woodland creatures clear your path, and even the fiercest beasts become your protectors.  
*Voice of a Disney Princess*  
Required:Canary  
Now your singing can be understood by all, from the birds to the dogs to any person, thus allowing it to affect all. You can Master anyone who understands you through singing. This also gives you the talent to make and sing songs on the spot. The effects of your Mastering has also become more subtle, giving you better control over it.

(Thinker) Checklist  
Cost: 3 SP  
You will automatically know six objects you will need in the next 24 hours, or at a specific occasion or event within this timeframe. This power can only be used once every 24 hours. It will focus on things considered more important, such as gear for an upcoming fight, over 20 bucks for your lunch.

[(Thinker/Master) Bribery Makes Everything Easier](#bookmark=id.i2ffnh836dbm)

(Thinker) Primal Perception  
Cost: 2 SP  
Your 5 senses are supernatural, allowing you to count all the leaves on a tree from a mile away. Find someone by their scent if they are within a mile of you. Being able to pinpoint the location of a needle by the sound it made when dropped on the floor in a busy mall. Feel the subtle changes in temperature and air density of someone or something going through the air. Taste the rich flavours of food down to the most exquisite detail, allowing you to truly appreciate the taste of the food people make. This also means that you can detect with ease if something is harmful to you.

(Thinker) Conspiracy Nut  
Cost: 2 SP  
You can intuit connections between events, people, things. For example, you can learn that Alexandria is somehow connected to Case 53s, however it doesn’t give an explanation on how they are connected. Any attacks you deal are imbued with an energy that causes wounds to heal slowly and incorrectly. You can toggle this power on and off.

[(Blaster) Voodoo](#bookmark=id.qdapjb5zhdo5)

(Striker/Blaster) Personalised Attack  
Cost: 6 SP  
Every one of your actions—whether a punch, a shot, or even a whisper—now carries a potent enhancement from your power. This boost is attuned to any piece of information you possess about your target. Whether you know their name, their personality, their fears, or even a single detail about their past, each bit of knowledge enhances the potency of your actions.

This power isn’t limited to dealing damage; it affects any interaction you have with your target. If you aim to heal them, even a fragment of familiarity—like knowing their favourite color or hometown—will amplify the effect, allowing you to restore them with greater intensity and speed. If you choose to harm or torment, even the smallest fact, like a nickname or a habit, will magnify their suffering, bringing their deepest vulnerabilities to the surface.

(Blaster/Trump) Imbue Projectile

(Blaster) Debuff  
Cost: 3 SP

(Blaster/Master) Earworm  
Cost: 3 SP  
Not only do your blasts hit with a good amount of kinetic energy, at most as strong as the strongest kick you could give, they also get ideas stuck in the victim's head. You can selectively blast someone with a blast that removes the earworms from their head.

#### Tinker

(Tinker) Terraforming  
Cost: 15 SP  
You are a tinker specializing in environmental technology with dual approaches to that specialty. One approach focuses on surviving hostile environments in various ways from specialized genemods, cybernetics, armor/clothing, vehicles, or shelters. The other focuses on changing the environment to suit your needs like purifying water on a large scale, changing the composition of the gases in the air, manipulating the materials composing the ground, dealing with radiation, dealing with heat or a lack of heat, and changing the weather. These approaches are not incompatible. If you work at it you might be able to make cybernetics or armor that can shoot bolts of electricity or manipulate the environment in various ways.  
While this specialty is very versatile it does not surpass specialties like thermal or cybernetics in their field it merely offers a specialized approach. Has great synergy with specialties related to either of its approaches.

(Tinker/Trump) Amplifiers and Dampeners  
Cost: 15 SP  
You can create pieces of technology that can either amplify or dampen power. The limits on how much you can suppress or boost powers depend on the size of the tinker tech and how experienced you are, and the smaller your tech is, the smaller the range to the point where ring or necklace-sized pieces of technology require physical contact to work, but in exchange for this limitation, the smaller the piece of technology, the more powerful the boost or dampener is, and the maximum limit of your boosting is 1000% of the original power. At first, you will barely be able to create pieces of Tinker Tech that are able to boost or dampen parahuman powers by 10% and are roughly the same size as a portable gas generator.  
And if you have negentropy, then your tech becomes capable of recharging and supercharging shards. Along with this, the boost your technology gives can reach over 1000%.

[(Tinker) I Wanna Be The Very Best\!](#bookmark=id.wn8udsqzumd9)

(Tinker) Time Dilation

Your Tinker power allows you to manipulate time on a localized scale. You can create devices that alter the flow of time, either speeding it up or slowing it down within a specific area or for specific objects. This power can be utilized for a variety of purposes, including time-based weaponry, time-limited force fields, or time-accelerated manufacturing processes. However, manipulating time comes with its own risks and challenges, as it requires precise control and understanding of temporal mechanics.

(Tinker) Destruction  
Cost: 14 SP  
You specialize in destruction, your Tinker Tech is made to be as dangerous as possible. You can create bullets that delete matter on contact, bombs that consume concrete like the plague, napalm that can last thousands of years, and so on. You can destroy and defeat Endbringers as well, but the price for it is what most would be considered not worth it.

(Tinker) Lasers\!  
Cost: 14 SP  
This power is to Legend’s Shard what Hero’s is to Stilling. You have the capacity to make devices that produce lasers with various effects limited by your creativity and the research you do.  
Examples include lasers that can turn corners, fork into multiple lasers, pass through walls, freeze, ignite targets, cutting, disintegration, impact, heat, focus, staccato bursts, fat lasers, and invisible lasers. These are just examples though you could develop lasers with capabilities other than those examples and combine effects.  
Your power also isn’t limited to just these forms of esoteric energy manipulation and support technology, the true purpose for this power is space travel so beyond dealing with harmful space energies, a form of FTL technology might not be out of reach, especially if this power is whiteboxed.  
(Tinker) Information  
Cost: 14 SP  
You can create machines capable of manipulating raw information. In its most basic state, you can create Stranger effects, such as making specific information impossible to process, causing it to slip from memory. You can also create machines meant to analyse others to gain information. In its more advanced stages, you could transform the state of information, converting virtual data into physical form and vice versa. The only flaw is that your technology has a limited range, incapable of affecting those far away.  
This pairs extremely well with (Tinker) Meme and (Tinker) Informational Hazard.

(Tinker) Code  
Cost: 15 SP  
You are a genius when it comes to Code. You could make AI that would revolutionize the world... if they didn't destroy it. Be careful with this power... if only there was a benevolent AI that could help...  
Warning: The Dragonslayers WILL try to kill you out of fear of AI.

(Tinker) Nuclear  
Cost: 14 SP  
You specialize in the manipulation of nuclear physics. The obvious use is to create nuclear reactors and bombs, but you can do much more than that. You can create machines that transmute elements, advanced diagnostic imaging machines such as X-ray or MRI machines.

(Tinker) Space  
Cost: 14 SP  
Your tinker power specializes in the manipulation of space, creating things such as teleportation pads, or a small device which allows small scale teleportation would be child's play to you. But you can do so much more than that, bend space much like vista with specialized devices, notably without the manton limits of regular powers, so do be careful. You could create things which are bigger or smaller on the inside. Your imagination is the limit when it comes to creating technology which has to do with space.  
   
(Tinker/Master) Nanobots  
Cost: 13 SP  
You can create robots as well as a headset to mentally control them. Your robots can make robots as well. There is no maximum or minimum size to your robots... well, they can't go subatomic, but that's the only real limit.  
You cannot program these robots without (Tinker) Code, and if you have (Tinker) Code you can overwrite the AI with your headset. You have unlimited multitasking.  
Nano-Fab  
Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Tinker/Master) Nanobots  
Your specialization extends to application of physics, engineering, and chemistry to built objects on extremely small scales (Nano, or pushing it, a little smaller).

(Tinker) Reproduction  
Cost: 12 SP  
You can reproduce the technology of any other Tinker. You can only reproduce technology you've analyzed. Any Tinkertech you've analyzed will be easier to convert to real tech, but only mildly so.

(Tinker) Self-Alteration  
Cost: 12 SP  
You are a Bio-Tinker/Protestician Hybrid that is focused on self-improvement. It is similar to Bonesaw's power, as the both of you will be able to learn a lot from each other, finding it easier to understand what each other's powers did and how they did them.  
This could be easily combined with most Tinker powers, with a few such as Bakuda being an exception.

(Tinker) Interdimensional  
Cost: 11 SP  
You can create technology that accesses other dimensions.  
You could make bullets that go through obstacles by sinking into another dimension, or goggles that let you see every dimension.

(Tinker) Weatherman  
Cost: 11 SP  
You specialise in the creation of long-term, wide area, indiscriminate effects. Your tech tree starts at effects covering a block and grows in range from there.  
Examples of things you could build are: a static generator that emits intense apathy upon everybody in a multi-block radius; a thick fog that forces immense downward gravitational pull upon every airborne object inside; you could even create direct weather events, forcing a city to endure a constant barrage of powerful lightning strikes from a permanent thunderstorm or survive an eternal sub-zero blizzard.

(Tinker) Escalation  
Cost: 11 SP  
Your tinker specialty is creating tinker tech that enhances itself through combat. By engaging in combat, your tech will start to ‘mature’, gaining features that make it stronger, better, and more versatile as time passes. By default, the maturing process takes 30 minutes, however this scales in proportion to the scale and danger of the combat. Should you leave combat or combat end before the current maturing process is done, the tech will slowly start to revert to its original state. The process can be rekindled should combat start again.  
When the maturing process finishes, another will start up soon after if the user is still in combat. Additions to your tech that have finished maturing can be added onto other tech like normal tinker tech.

(Tinker) Reconfiguration  
Cost: 11 SP  
You specialize in creating Adaptive Tinker Tech that can reconfigure itself based on threats it comes across. The better information is fed and analyzed, the better the adaptations it creates. It can grow adaptations during combat and outside of it, although it is much faster while in conflict. Your Tinker Tech is very costly, and if it runs out of fed materials it will stop adapting.

(Tinker) Self Replicating  
Cost: 11 SP  
You can make anything you build self-replicating. This ranges from giving bio-tinkered creations the ability to reproduce to making machines able to create copies of themselves. The only limitation is that your technology cannot self-replicate if it lacks the needed materials. This can be worked around by having the replicated version be inferior to the original. If it can already self-replicate, then you can make it even more efficient, such as allowing people to undergo mitosis instead of requiring pregnancy.

(Tinker) Remote Control  
Cost: 10 SP  
You are a tinker specializing in remote controlled technology such as drones. Drones can be improved with research and development. They can be given specialized roles and technologies for different purposes but that is initially limited to things like say a taser drone or a flame lighter drone. Other facets of this speciality besides drones and the associated support technology is various bits and pieces that allow advanced communication between technology, advanced computers, advanced programming (not capable of making advanced AI by itself not without years of development), and computer-brain interface technology.

(Tinker) Fortifications and Artillery  
Cost: 11 SP  
Your specialty is the making of anything that cannot be easily moved. If you had a couple of good shots, you could probably kill an Endbringer with one of your guns.

(Tinker) Domain  
Cost: 10 SP  
You are a Tinker specialised in the creation of custom pocket dimensions of varying properties. The more the physics of a pocket dimension differs from the real world, the more expensive creating and maintaining the pocket dimension will be.  
An ever-shifting escherian labyrinth within which to trap your enemies; a subspace through which you can thread the bulk of your other technology in order to make it impossibly small; or even an arena with physics favourable to your powers that you can temporarily kidnap people into; all are within the realm of possibility for you.  
*Extraterritorial Enforcement*  
Required: (Tinker) Interdimensional, or (Tinker) Space  
The line between reality and the dimensions you craft have blurred. You can now design your pocket dimensions to be capable of overlapping or intersecting with the real world at will, imposing your custom physics upon the world directly.

Cost: 10 SP  
You have the ability to build tinkertech that imitates your non-tinker powers. Additionally, you are able to study and analyze the abilities of others to create items that replicate their abilities to some degree, though it is impossible to fully recreate them perfectly.

Cost: 5 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Techie  
As you advance your Techie specializations, and discover new applications of that technology; your powers will update with new capabilities based on your technological advancement.  
Applied Technology  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:(Tinker) Techie  
Now you also get a non-tinker power based on each and every power you’ve purchased that gives you access to a tech tree/the ability to build advanced technology.
