Special Containment Procedures: SCP-███ as of its interaction with Project: █████, SCP-███ Is now capable of utilizing entities contained within or related to SCP-1730, This includes kinetohazards, the containment zones utilized to contain entities within, up to and including Olympia class, alongside theoretical access's to the infamous thresher device.

As of ████ Attempts to contain SCP-███ are now impossible attempted recontainment has failed due to SCP-███ disappearance, likely through the usage of the thresher device to enter another timeline, or universe.

Sacred Gear Engineer (DxD)  
Cost: 15 SP  
Required:The Craftsman  
Required:Holy Light (DxD)  
You obtained the knowledge and skills to construct artificial Sacred Gears, rivalling the leader of the fallen angels, Azazel. These are powerful soulbound artefacts that can be summoned by their wielder, granting them unique powers. This includes the ability to both extract them from their current hosts and implant them into new ones by yourself without requiring a Sacred Gear extractor or killing their current host.  
Most of the powerful Sacred Gears are designed to have a being sealed in them as their source of power and abilities, so this power also grants you knowledge of appropriate sealing techniques that were used by the God of the Bible for this purpose.

Artificial Sacred Gears are inferior to the real ones, having several limits and side effects. For example, after some time has passed, an artificial Sacred Gear can cause fatigue after their usage and may affect both the powers and abilities of the wielder if said wielder uses them for long periods of time. But with further research and mastery, these drawbacks can be removed, and it is possible to create true Sacred Gears.

In the beginning, you will be limited to more basic ones like the Applause Wall, which is capable of making strong barriers; the Scouting Persona, which can create floating masks designed for surveillance; or even the more basic original Sacred Gears, like a Twice Critical, which is a gauntlet capable of doubling the power of the user for a certain time.  
But you can also modify normal artefacts, including objects of power, to act like a Sacred Gear, including the possibility to develop new sub-species powers and even a Balance Breaker state. Or even upgrade and rebuild the original Sacred Gears with sufficient research, with the potential to even create a new Longinus.

Deus Mechanicus  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:Deus Est Machina (40k)  
Required:Sacred Gear (DxD)  
Your Sacred Gear has merge with your power over technology, and becoming a unique sub-species of the Longinus Sacred Gear "Unknown Dictator" which holds dominion over the very concept of Technology and Progress, allowing it to tap into the boundless potential of innovation and invention. At its core resides a Machine God, an ancient entity hailing from the enigmatic Evie race—a civilization of god-like robots.

The base ability of the Unknown Dictator is to seize control and reshape any technology or object within its vicinity. Unfettered by the constraints of reality, the wielder's imagination and available materials become the only limits to their creations. Through a mere thought, the wielder can transform a decrepit, rusted machine into a marvel of engineering from a distant, futuristic epoch.

With a wave of your hand, an abandoned truck's exterior would gleams with ethereal luminescence, masking its presence from prying eyes using advanced cloaking technology. The mundane engine within vanishes, replaced by an ethereal anti-gravity drive, enabling it to soar through the skies like a majestic bird. The driver's seat molds into a plush cockpit, assimilating an AI capable of autonomous decision-making, making self-driving a mere child's play.

The Unknown Dictator's influence extends beyond mere technological transformations. When the wielder stands at the helm of a battlefield, any equipment within their grasp is imbued with an otherworldly aura. Bullets hum with unprecedented accuracy, their trajectory molded to perfection. Shields fortify themselves with an energy barrier, absorbing the impact of even the most fearsome onslaughts.

Yet, the true marvel of the Unknown Dictator lies in its potential for evolution. As the wielder unlocks newfound depths of creativity and understanding, the Machine God within the sacred gear slowly awakens and merges with their very being. With each new creation, the wielder existence is slowly elevated, walking the path to become the Omnissiah, the True God of Machines, Technology's, Progress, Inventions, and Innovations.

Necrons (40k)  
Cost: 10 SP  
Required:Cryptek (40k)  
You can now synthesize and create the sentient xenos machine species known as the Necrons.

Utilizing a specialized living metal called Necrodermis, you can breath to life various types of Necrons, ranging from frontline troops like warriors to even overlords and phaeron, and everything in between. This also encompasses Necron constructs like Canoptek Spyders, Destroyers, and even Wraiths. You have within you the power to breathe life into Necrons with such perfection that even the Silent King's body, crafted by the C'tan themselves, would pale in comparison.

Naturally, the larger and more powerful the creation, the greater the quantity of Necrodermis required, though you possess an inherent awareness of the necessary amounts for each creation.

To obtain Necrodermis, you can transmute regular metals into it when in proximity to that metal. Conductive metals will yield a superior ratio of transmuted Necrodermis. For instance, 1 kilo of silver will grant you 1 kilo of Necrodermis, whereas 1 kilo of stainless steel will only produce 500 grams of the living metal. You can transmute 1 kilo of Necrodermis if you have the equivalent ratio of the appropriate conductive metal within one-tenth of a second.

To the Necrons and your other creations, you are the unchallenged sovereign, your word a law they are bound to uphold. This allegiance is unwavering, transcending distinctions of intelligence, awareness, and inherent nature. Regardless of their complexity, each and every one of the entities you have brought into being, along with those subsequently birthed from your creations, is innately aware of your sovereign authority. They are instinctively and unfailingly devoted to fulfilling your commands, bound by an unbreakable perfect loyalty that endures throughout their eternal existence.

You have the option to impart the full technology and knowledge of the Necron eternal empire to your Necrons, from their absolute peak at the war in heaven to their current state, either partially or fully, according to your discretion.

The Necrons are genuinely immortal, possessing the ability to regenerate from any injury given enough time. However, as their creator, you have the power to instantly terminate any of them whenever you want, by simply reclaiming the life spark you granted them, reducing them to inert Necrodermis metal.

C'tan Shards (40k)  
Cost: 35 SP  
Required:Necrons (40k)  
The C'tan, once revered as gods, embodied the sheer might of the universe in the form of nearly omnipotent sentient beings. However, those days have long passed, and the gods have been vanquished, shattered into thousands of shards by their own servitors the necrons. These shards, each locked away and concealed, harbor the immeasurable power of the C'tan.

Even now in their reduced and wholly fettered state, C'tan Shards are beings of near-unlimited power. They can manifest energy blasts, control the minds of lesser beings, manipulate the flow of time, and banish foes to alternate dimensions. Indeed, a C'tan Shard's abilities are limited only by two things: its imagination \-- which is immense \-- and glimmering memories of the being from which it was severed. Whilst no individual C'tan Shard has full recall of the omnipotent being it once was, each carries the personality and hubris of that vaster and more puissant being.

Now, you possess the keys to unleash and use every C'tan shard held by the Necrons, in an alternative dimension only you can access. The Necrons had only unleashed these god like beings in the most dire circumstances, fearing that, despite the failsafes and precautions in place, there remained a small chance however remote for the shards to escape and attempt to overthrow their captors, reclaiming their position once again as the rulers of the universe. However, you share not this concern, as these shards like your Necron creations, will exhibit perfect loyalty to you, offering their overwhelming power in eternal servitude.

Time Lord (Doctor Who)  
Cost: 40 SP  
You are a Time Lord in your first incarnation, this new physiology and relatively unique position provides various abilities. Time Lords have 13 incarnations, each one having a full lifespan of several centuries, unless ended early by violence or other factors. When an incarnation ends, barring the final one, a Time Lord will Regenerate, completely restoring them, with their 'age' reset, and with a brand new personality and appearance; Many things such as sex, gender, and what have you can change in this process. They are the same person underneath it all, but expressed through the lens of their current incarnation. What sets you apart from most Time Lords is that you have complete control over the details of your regenerations, enabling you to retain your current personality and appearance if you choose to do so. Every 120 years, your Regeneration Cycle resets, replenishing your remaining charges back to 12 as you do not need the Time Lord Council to grant you more.  
As a multidimensional being with an affinity towards and psychic resonance with the dimension of Time, you exert a subtle and unconscious influence on the universe. Nothing truly powerful, just a little bit of luck here, or being just in the right place to handle a crisis there. The chakras of your nervous system can feel the texture of the time vortex and allow you to feel temporal anomalies, noticing alterations as sudden gut revulsion is a common synesthesia. You're undeniably brilliant by human standard, but about average for a Time Lord, and retain the truly staggering education Time Lord society offers its members; you have what amounts to multiple human lifetimes’ worth of schooling, covering broad swathes of skills and nearly encyclopedic knowledge. Your particular exposure to the Time Vortex has placed the information to recreate any technology from the Doctor Who series in your mind.  
Beyond the oddity of Regenerations, your body is somewhat anomalous compared to humans. Your strength and durability are mildly superhuman, your respiratory system can retain much more air and even protect you from the void of space for brief periods. There's two hearts in your chest, increasing your cardiovascular load, while your body both resists and filters out radiation to a rather high degree, as it is a significant danger when travelling through space and time. You can even enter a healing coma, tuning your outward metabolism down far enough to emulate death while internally your body goes into overdrive to heal most severe non-fatal injuries at an accelerated pace. Finally, there are a myriad of other unique minor physiological tricks that generally serve to give you an edge in whatever the latest crisis you find yourself in.

*Amenominakanushi*

You are also able to affect yourself and others or objects you touch, able to force overlapping matter into your personal dimension, in your case causing intangibility. You can also use this offensively by utilizing it either through weapons you empower with the effect, your body, or your other techniques by forcing any matter that overlaps with them into the other dimension, without the innate protection that allows them to stay connected like you would with yourself allowing you to cleave through almost any defense. As a side effect of your power, by travelling into your personal dimension you are able to find where anything or anyone you are searching for is, and can teleport there from your personal dimension.  
*Rokudō no Odori*  
Required:Chakra Fruit (Naruto)  
Your domain and control has been greatly expanded, now extending to an additional 6 pocket dimensions for yourself all having the same functionality as the original. You can create a single field or multiple fields, and are able to shape the fields however you like provided they are within the stated range.

Each of these effects can be applied to either your body, jutsu, weapons, or others but only one effect can be applied to one thing at a time but all three effects can be applied individually to different things. The Kusanagi no Tsurugi, grants anything you imbue the ability to kill anything with a single strike, from the smallest cut to the fatalist strike, from something as simple as a leaf to a bullet to a jutsu. Provided it hits what you intended it will kill.

The Yasakani no Magatama, grants anything you imbue the ability to immediately and guarantee to travel and if you choose it, to hit it regardless of any defenses in its way. Although this does nothing for the durability of the thing your hitting, it merely ensures it will hit.

Required:Chakra Fruit (Naruto)

Eternal Rinnegan (Naruto)  
Cost: 10 SP

Required:Rinnegan (Naruto)  
As your Rinnegan awakens, your Uchiha lineage pulsates with newfound vigour, granting you a wealth of techniques surpassing conventional expectations. Each of your paths gains an additional ability to start with.

The Asura Path gains the power of Yahata. Through it you gain an increased level of physical ability, roughly on par with a mature nine-tails jinchūriki empowered by Six Paths Senjutsu and a healing ability like Creation Rebirth without any of the negative side effects.

The Human Path gains the power of Yūrei. Through it you gain the ability to shift, into and back, in a ghost like state where you can selectively choose to be intangible, invisible, inaudible and grants you the ability to fly. The Animal Path gains the power of Limbo. Through it you gain the ability to manifest four extra dimensional clones, impervious to detection by any natural or supernatural senses, or any physical damage through conventional means. These clones share any ability or powers you may have. You can also instantaneously teleport between your four clones, swiftly evading any threats that you may find unescapable.

The Preta Path gains the power of Sentan. Through it you gain the ability to transform defeated enemies into a chakra filled edibles in the shape of a chakra fruit. With the passage of time, your connection to the Rinnegan deepens, unlocking further techniques, each one echoes the eternal essence of the Uchiha bloodline coursing through your veins, exemplifying the indomitable legacy you bear.

Byakugan (Naruto)  
Cost: 12 SP  
Originating with the Ōtsutsuki Clan, the Byakugan is one of the "Three Great Dōjutsu" alongside the Sharingan and Rinnegan. They grant the bearer a near-360º field of vision around themselves, save for a small blindspot at the back of the neck above the first thoracic vertebra.

You can focus your vision on anything within the range of your Byakugan, and can penetrate nearly any object, being able to see through walls, underground, or even the contents of someone's body. You can see chakra to a greater extent than someone with a Sharingan, including the 361 tenketsu points along someone's chakra pathway.

The Byakugan's ability to see chakra grants increased resistance to falling under genjutsu, but doesn't completely remove the risk. They can, however, be used to increase the effectiveness of your own genjutsu.

These eyes operate without expending any energy, and suffer from no strain or fatigue from prolonged and uninterrupted use, wield them as you wish.

*Ancestral Byakugan*  
Required:Chakra Fruit (Naruto)  
The power of the Ōtsutsuki has suffused through you, awakening an evolution of your Byakugan, granting you a dōjutsu on par with that of the mother of chakra, Kaguya, herself. Your Byakugan is now also capable of seeing infrared radiation, determine the level of chakra development someone has, even to the extent of whether or not they can mold chakra at all, and to see into a target's mind to determine their thoughts and feelings, even to look through their memories. The range of your Byakugan is now great enough to reach the extents of entire nations.

Rinnegan (Naruto)  
Cost: 20 SP  
The Eyes of God are yours now. The Rinnegan’s name might sound overly grandiose, but be assured, it is not. You have these eyes now, along with all the powers that come with them.  
These take the form of multiple ‘paths’, each with its own abilities. You can use all of these powers in one body if you want, but you can also use multiple bodies, one for each path. Each path has it’s own theme as well as two passive effects that are always active. Where it would matter these things stack with and augment any such affinities, control, or reserves you already possess.  
First of all you have the Deva Path, which grants you control over the physical world and its fundamental forces. You will start out with instinctive control over gravity but as you practice more and more of the physical world will fall under your purview. This path’s passive buffs are, exceptional affinities in all five normal elements and the ability to freely mix whatever elements you can manipulate.

The second path is the Asura Path. This path gives you dominion over your own body, allowing you to manipulate and transmute it in whatever way you desire. You can create metal, transmute your body into a cyborg and back, or even heal yourself freely. Whatever is generated from your body can transmit your chakra, even when it is no longer connected to your body. This Path’s first passive buff is an incredibly powerful body and vitality granting exceptional Yang chakra, and a monstrous chakra capacity, either half the size of the Jūbi’s or double your own, whatever is greater.  
The Human Path grants you dominion over the mind and souls of people, including your own. You can manipulate them and interact with them directly, so much so that you could even extract their memories from them with just a touch. This Path’s passive buffs are an increased mental acuity granting exceptional Yin Chakra, and extremely fine control over your chakra.  
The Animal Path, the fourth path, grants you access to summoning. Any being that you personally defeat and/or kill can be summoned by you. However you are not limited to this and will over time learn to summon anything and everything, such as summoning the souls and bodies of people who have long since died, or even creating portals to summon yourself elsewhere. This Path’s passive buff is that any trials or requirements to get summons are smoothed over due to this, and the ability to summon anything that is considered “yours” to your person at any time.  
The Preta Path allows you to absorb anything and everything from your surroundings, even from other people or techniques headed at you. You can not only absorb this, but convert it to chakra so you can add it to your own reserves, even to the extent of increasing your overall pool to a reduced extent. This Path’s passive buffs is an innate ability to analyze and break down the structure and knowledge of anything you absorb, and an incredibly adaptive chakra system allowing you to replicate the properties and characteristics of whatever you absorb.  
The Naraka Path grants dominion over the metaphysical and the underlying fundamentals of reality. You’ll start off with instinctive control over life and death, allowing at the start to repair the bodies of living things or even, at an immense chakra cost, resurrect the dead. This path will require the usage of other paths to channel it’s abilities through, but over time will allow you to use it just through this. This path’s passive buffs are an instinctive understanding of reality, and the ability to directly interact with the forces you’ve gained control over.  
These eyes operate without expending any energy, and suffer from no strain or fatigue from prolonged and uninterrupted use, wield them as you wish.

All Seeing Eyes of God (Blood Blockade Battlefront/Kekkai Sensen)  
Cost: 15 SP  
You are able to see the 'The Truth' of the world. You have numerous abilities including heightened visual senses, allowing you to see fast movements normally impossible for human eyes to follow, or minor details with great clarity, and allows you to clearly gaze both the past and flawlessly predict the future. You are able to see past world altering illusions and perceive an individual's unique aura. This eyes also reveal the "true name" of all beings.  
You are also capable of altering and controlling the vision of those around you, such as switching two people's field of vision, inducing nauseating hallucinations, projecting what you see into the minds of others, and the power over visual illusions in general. The eyes also allow you to see through another individual's eyes and observe past events that they have witnessed. The eyes can also be used to track body parts that have been removed or extracted from a person even when it cannot normally be traced by conventional means simply by viewing the aura of the person and matching it with said body part.  
The eyes do have their limits, however. Prolonged use of the eyes' abilities causes them to heat up to the point where they will start burning the user. If the eyes are damaged enough, they will crack, making their powers unusable until they heal back again. Do beware many entities may not like you seeing the Truth about them.

Shadow Monarch (Solo Levelling)  
Cost: 25 SP  
You become the vessel of the Shadow Monarch.

As the Monarch of Shadows, Ruler of the Dead you are capable of extracting the Shadows of the dead, though there’s a chance of failure if the being is significantly stronger than you or had been dead for a long time. Three attempts may be made on the same being before you can no longer attempt to extract their Shadow.

While Shadows start slightly weaker than when they were alive, they gradually get stronger the more they kill and can eventually evolve into greater beings. You can only hold onto so many Shadows at a time; however, as you grow more experienced in wielding this power, this limit increases. Stored Shadows are kept inside your own shadow. Additionally, you can use your shadow to store items.

You can use shadows as portals to travel vast distances in an instant, create shadow constructs, and telekinetically move objects through your authority as a ruler. You can create a domain by projecting your own shadow, which further amplifies your powers and strengthens any Shadows within by 50%. Finally, you can form armor from shadows that greatly increases all your powers and abilities by concentrating a large amount of power around yourself.

Champion of the World Eater (Marvel)  
Cost: 65 SP  
Through the benevolence of Galactus, you have been granted the extraordinary transformation bestowed upon his Heralds, along with unrestricted access to the awe-inspiring Power Cosmic. This transformative process empowers you with strength and durability comparable to the an enraged Hulk, incredible speed and flight capable of traversing the vast expanse of the universe in mere moments, supreme agility almost capable of seizing a fully empowered Infinity Gauntlet from the clutches of Thanos himself, and heightened senses allowing you to perceive and interact with aspects of reality beyond the comprehension of mortal beings.

Moreover, this process elevates your Mind and Soul, enabling you to engage with and communicate with the most potent cosmic forces without succumbing to their overwhelming influence.

The greatest gift of this transformation is the infusion of the Power Cosmic into the very essence of your being. This enhancement fortifies every aspect of yourself, including your physical, mental, and spiritual attributes, while also amplifying your existing abilities with the boundless energy of the universe.

Access to the Power Cosmic bestows upon you remarkable abilities, including Cosmic energy manipulation and projection, giving you mastery over the cosmic energies and fundamental forces of the universe, and enabling you to wield them for offensive, defensive, and utilitarian purposes, Cosmic awareness, which expands your consciousness to encompass the vastness of the universe, allowing you to comprehend and perceive its intricacies on both a universal and multiversal scale, virtual immortality and invulnerability to all but the most formidable cosmic effects, molecular manipulation, resurrection, telepathy, telekinesis, lifeforce manipulation, dimensional travel, time travel, and a myriad of other powers waiting to be discovered through your exploration and mastery.

Lastly, as a symbol of your position as a Herald, you will be bestowed with a unique Item/Vehicle/Weapon. This artifact can be customised to align with your personal preference, much like the Surfer's iconic Board, Frank's trusted Bike, or the wielders of the Axe.  
Note: The limitations of the Power Cosmic are solely determined by the extent of your imagination and your willingness to explore and harness its limitless potential.

### Object of Power

Mandarin Rings (Marvel)  
Cost: 25 SP  
The Rings are ten cylinders of Makulan technology, each housing the soul of a long dead cosmic warrior, trapped in a phantasmal state by the devices. Each of the rings provide a different set of abilities.

The first is the Remaker, which will allow the one who wears it the ability to manipulate the atomic and molecular structure of matter. This can be used to solidify gas, change lead to gold, to even healing others.  
The second is Influence, which allows the manipulation of force, predominantly in the form of concussive and sonic beams and blasts.  
The third is Spin, which allows the manipulation of air. Most often used to create a powerful vortex, this ring can be used to propel the wearer through the air and levitate and manipulate objects. This can be used as a form of pseudo-telekinesis.  
The fourth is Spectral, which can be used to project beams that destroy the bonds between atoms and molecules, causing whatever was hit to disintegrate. Has a secondary ability that can allow the user to turn invisible.  
The fifth is Nightbringer, which can enshroud a large area in darkness.  
The sixth is Daimonic, amongst the most versatile of the rings, this one allows the manipulation of electromagnetic energy. This can be used to create powerful blinding blasts of light, magnetic levitation and manipulation, and can be used to create holographic images. Also grants some control over gravity.  
The seventh is Incandescence, which allows the wearer to produce blasts of infrared to produce flame or ignite combustible materials.  
The eighth is The Liar, which grants the wearer powerful telepathic abilities, allowing one to tap into and manipulate the thoughts of others, cast illusions, and even paralyze others.  
The ninth is Lightning, which allows one to project powerful blasts of electrical energy.  
The tenth and final one is Zero, which allows the user to project powerful waves and blasts of intense cold and ice, capable of flashing freezing within seconds.

Mirran Sword Set (Magic: The Gathering)  
Cost: 30 SP  
This magic set of swords are fabled in their power, a single one being able to turn the tides in a battle. This however isn’t a single sword, but the whole set in one. You can change the current sword with a thought. Be aware, the sword effects only last while they are in their active form.  
Sword of Truth and Justice: So long you feel that your cause is just, you gradually keep gaining strength while in combat.  
Sword of Once and Future: You can see the moves your opponent will use, and your reaction time increases.  
Sword of Sinew and Steel: Hits caused by the sword will turn the target brittle, stacking to the point that a gust will break them. This damage is hard to recover.  
Sword of Forge and Frontier: Each hit that lands on the enemy increases in force on the next hit. It is cumulative, not multiplicative.  
Sword of Hearth and Home: Your allies gain strength and vitality while around you, their resolve to fight will grow,slowly healing their wounds.  
Sword of Light and Shadow: When causing damage to an enemy, you drain them of their vitality. You can use this energy to heal yourself or an ally.  
Sword of Feast and Famine: The longer you fight an enemy, the faster they will tire, the more their wounds will bleed and fester, slowly draining than of their force.  
Sword of Body and Mind: Each time you attack, you create an echo that has the same powers as you. That echo lasts for 15 seconds, and coordinates telepathically with you.  
Sword of Fire and Ice: The sword is covered by a cold-fire that spreads on your enemies and can't be extinguished. You can select what it will hurt and won't.  
Sword of War and Peace: While this sword is active, you get stronger the more allies you have, and your enemies slowly lose the will to fight.

The Golden Army (Hellboy)  
Cost: 20 SP  
The Golden Army, also known as the "Unstoppable Force," was a formidable clockwork army consisting of 4,900 mechanical warriors, each towering over humans in both size and strength. These mechanical soldiers, forged by goblin blacksmiths with ancient magic and unparalleled craftsmanship, were designed to be self-repairing, making them virtually indestructible. No matter the damage inflicted upon them, they would reassemble themselves, returning to battle with undiminished power. They were capable of devastation beyond imagination. Humans were no match for the sheer strength, durability, and relentless nature of these mechanical soldiers. A single soldier could cleave through dozens of men in one sweep, and entire battalions fell in moments beneath their crushing weight. No weapon could pierce their armor, no tactic could slow them. Their relentless, tireless nature made them a force feared by all who opposed them.

Commissioned by King Balor during the ancient wars between the mythical races and mankind, the Golden Army was created as the ultimate weapon to crush humanity. However, after witnessing the devastation and the toll of war, Balor's conscience led him to lock the army away, fearing that such immense power would corrupt anyone who wielded it. Hidden deep within an impenetrable vault, the Golden Army lay dormant, awaiting a new master.

Now, with the keys to their vault in your hands, you have been given command over this unstoppable army. You were given the Crown of Bethmora, giving you command over the army. Their mechanical eyes flicker to life at your command, and the earth trembles as 4,900 indestructible warriors rise to serve you. Be wary as any with Royal Blood can challenge you for your crown, and this control over your army.

The True Cloak of Invisibility (Harry Potter)  
Cost: 10 SP  
The True cloak of invisibility was once a part of Death's own cloak. With this, so long as you remain covered, you are invisible to all mortals, but still visible to those that have already died. It is virtually indestructible, can shrink or enlarge to cover up to three people, and will never lose its potency. However, it is not infallible. People can still detect you via non-optical means, and while the cloak itself is indestructible, it doesn't offer this boon to you.  
*Master of Death*  
Required: The Elder Wand (Harry Potter)  
Required: The Resurrection Stone (Harry Potter)  
You accepted your mortality. As Master of Death, you understand that Death is part of life, and while it doesnt make you suicidal or reckless in any way, you are in peace with it.  
You become biologically ageless, becoming younger and older at will. You know when death is coming to others, and can offer to let them have a peaceful death, and guide them to their afterlife. You gain an affinity for spells related to life and death, and know when someone cheated death. Whatever you kill, it becomes impossible to bring back.  
The Relics now recognize only you as their master, and will only work for others if you lend or give it to them.  
*Shroud of Death*  
Required:Reaper of Souls  
As the personification of Death itself, the true power of the Invisibility Cloak is revealed to you.  
The Cloak can take the form of any clothing you desire and is capable of perfectly concealing you from all things, even the dead. The cloak covers more than just visible means of detection, concealing your scent and deafening your movements. It can even shield you from passive magic, allowing you to pass through complex and powerful wards as if they didn’t exist. If you so desire then you can turn off the concealment or even have it only selectively hide you from certain people.  
However, there is an even further level of concealment available to you. When you actively channel magic into the Cloak it goes a step further and conceals you from the universe itself, allowing you to phase through anything, even magic. You are an ethereal, a silent but omnipresent wraith.

The Elder Wand (Harry Potter)  
Cost: 10 SP  
The Elder Wand is one of the three Deathly Hallows, and you have become its master. This wand will always be loyal to you and you alone, significantly amplifying any magic it casts. You can make charms and transfigurations permanent, and charms become more potent. In a duel, you will almost always emerge victorious against someone weaker than you, but you will be challenged when it comes to someone of equal or greater strength.  
*Scythe of Death*  
Required:Reaper of Souls  
As the personification of Death itself, the true power of the Elder Wand is revealed to you.  
The Wand can take the form of any weapon or focus you desire and serves as the perfect conduit and focus for all of your powers. The boost to magic you cast extends to all powers channeled through the Wand, and the boost is further amplified when channeling abilities related to life and death. Furthermore, all abilities related to life and death have their costs drastically reduced when channeled through the Wand, to the point of being effectively free to use.  
The mastery of magic the Wand bestows upon you has ingrained itself into your soul, making the usage of all forms of magic and other supernatural energies much smoother for you. Your power effortlessly flows within you and seems almost eager to follow your command, providing an intuitive understanding of the intricacies of your own spells.  
   
The Resurrection Stone (Harry Potter)  
Cost: 5 SP  
The Resurrection Stone is one of the three Deathly Hallows, and it is a magical object that can summon the spirits of those who have passed away. You need to hold the stone and turn it three times in your hand to use it. Once you do this, the spirits will appear translucent, and you can communicate with them or give them instructions. However, it's important to remember that those who return to life through the stone do not belong in the world of the living, and it's essential to allow them to return to their resting place.  
*Will of Death*  
Required:Reaper of Souls  
As the personification of Death itself, the true power of the Resurrection Stone is revealed to you.  
The Stone has merged with your body, suffusing your essence with its power. With a mere thought you can call forth the spirits of the dead, effortlessly manifesting them in the real world. These spirits may be granted semi or even fully corporeal bodies if you so desire, allowing them to more actively carry out your will. Additionally, no force may bar you from calling a spirit and restoring it to life, the Stone serving as a form of absolute Authority.  
The Authority of the Stone now extends to all forms of the dead, not just the spirits you conjure yourself. This allows you to issue absolute orders to all forms of the dead, orders which can only be contested by a being of similar status as yourself.

Irminsul (Genshin Impact)  
Cost: 20 SP  
You have gained something incredible: the seedling of Irminsul, the world tree of Teyvat.

Once planted, the seedling will begin to assimilate into the fabric of reality of whichever world it is placed in. Its roots will start absorbing energy, memory, and information from the world to grow the tree.  
Besides absorbing memory, the roots will also become the new leyline system of that world, generating and regulating the flow of elemental energy within the land.  
If there is already a leyline system in the world, it will slowly be assimilated into the root system. From then on, the form of energy flowing through the original system will also be generated and regulated by Irminsul.  
As the one who planted the tree, you are granted a special connection to it, allowing you to access its repository of information and harness the energy generated by its roots to fuel whatever power you may have.  
Beware that particularly hazardous energy or information, such as forbidden knowledge or eldritch truths, will be harder for the tree to record and integrate into its system. This will cause dangerous anomalies to appear in the world until the tree adapts to such energy/knowledge and everything is incorporated.  
*Irminsul Avatar*  
Required:Archon (Genshin Impact)  
As an elemental god, your connection to Irminsul has been significantly strengthened. Like Nahida, your consciousness is now directly linked to and in control of the tree.  
This grants you the ability not only to access but also to alter the information stored within the tree, thereby changing the perception of everyone around you and historical records according to the new information. However, be aware that any being free from the influence of fate or those with a will strong enough to rival an entire world cannot have their memories altered by this capability.  
You can also control the roots of Irminsul and, consequently, the leyline system, allowing you to cause natural disasters at will or terraform the environment as you see fit.  
Additionally, any supernatural energy you possess will now be generated and regulated by the root system.  
*Fantasy Tree (Type-Moon)*  
Required:Old Magic (Type-Moon)  
Thanks to your ability to use magic from the age of gods, your Irminsul seedling has taken on the trait of the fantasy tree that sustains a Lostbelt.  
The tree now recognizes you as its King and grants you great authority to shape the world wherever its influence reaches.  
These powers grow in strength as the tree forcefully integrates itself into the fabric of reality wherever it is planted, becoming an integral part of the world and imposing its rule over it.  
*New Yggdrasil*  
Required:Archon (Genshin Impact)  
Required:Mythos (Final Fantasy XVI)  
Required:Dragon  
As a Dragon Sovereign and lord of the elements, your absolute control over elemental forces has caused Irminsul to evolve beyond its original limits. It has transformed from a mere part of the world into a framework designed to gestate new worlds.  
Initially, Irminsul will have gestated only one world at its heart, equivalent in size to our solar system. The fundamental foundation of this world will be elemental energy, along with any other form of energy you possess.

As the world continues to develop and flourish with life, the tree will convert the generated memory and information into energy. This energy will be used both to fuel the growth of the world and to begin the gestation of new worlds.

This process will create a feedback loop. As more worlds are created, new life will form, bringing more memory and experience to further fuel the growth of additional worlds.  
In time, Irminsul might even come to rival the Imaginary Tree, with each of the countless branches in its canopy being a universe in its own right. However, this is in the far future, millions if not billions of years away from the humble single world it has now.  
*Gaia Reborn*  
Required:The Moon Cell Automaton (Type-Moon)  
By incorporating the Moon Cell into itself, Irminsul has not only gained all of its capabilities and functions but has also grown tremendously thanks to the 4.6 billion years of data and records provided by the Moon Cell.

This growth has allowed Irminsul to create an exact replica of planet Earth, complete with all its textures and inhabitants, as it existed in Type-Moon, within a reality marble.  
Your connection to the tree grants you the privilege to wield any form of mystery that has ever existed on Type-Moon Earth, including but not limited to every form of magecraft, psychic power, magic from the Age of Gods, true magic, and divine authority.  
If you also have the Irminsul avatar add-on, you will become an existence similar to the will of the planet Gaia and Alaya, giving you full access to a Counter Force and a Throne of Heroes of your own.  
*Tree of Feelings*  
Required: Essence of Darkness (Undertale), or Essence of Light (Undertale)  
Your affinity for Positivity or Negativity has mutated your Irminsul Sapling into something more, flowering with the beginnings of “apples” which are manifestations of pure Emotion.  
While they aren’t ready yet, as your sapling matures so too do the blooms which grow there until they eventually bear fruit. If you possess Essence of Darkness your tree grows Black Apples of Negativity, while Essence of Light would have it grow Golden Apples of Positivity.  
Once the apples are mature you can pluck and eat them, empowering you on a fundamental level as the energy within is absorbed, enhancing your connection with your Emotion. Should you eat 200 apples then you could achieve a connection comparable to the Avatar of Negativity/Avatar of Positivity upgrades.  
Lastly, everywhere your tree has influence it spreads and reinforces the emotions you hold an affinity for, empowering you within its domain. In fact, should you possess both Essence of Darkness and Essence of Light then you can actively manage the emotional influence, selectively targeting some areas with increased Negativity while increasing Positivity everywhere else.

Noah's Ark (D Gray-man)  
Cost: 30 SP  
Noah's Ark is a mysterious white city, separated from the rest of reality. Originally, it was a tool used by the Noah Family in their war against Innocence, but somehow it has fallen into your hands.

As the new owner, you possess the power to control every aspect of the Ark—the layout, appearance, destination, and even its resting place. By simply willing it and playing the piano at the Ark's center, you can open white, jagged, numbered gates to any location within the multiverse you inhabit. Should you choose, you can also switch the Ark’s connection to a different multiverse. Access through these gates is restricted to only those you trust.

The Ark contains extra-dimensional spaces known as "rooms," which can range from entire ecosystems to vast tracts of land. When you open a gate, a corresponding number appears above doors in a central hub, allowing for quick and easy travel.

With time, you will gain the ability to control the Ark without needing to play the piano. Additionally, if you possess a power that creates a universe or some type of world tree, Noah's Ark will become the center of that power.

The Ark has enough space to support a self-sustaining civilization and comes with a loyal Clan of Noah, reminiscent of the original 14 Noah, including characters like Road, Tyki Mikk, and Lulu Bell.

Death's Sickles (Dreamworks)  
Cost: 15 SP  
With a whistle on the wind you find yourself with a pair of sickles, at first glance they seem quite normal with a few features such as extending shafts that combine together and blades able to lock into place at different angles allowing you to use them like sickles, blade knuckles and double headed scythes.  
However; there is a power within. A sense of finality. For these are Death's Tool. Not metaphorically, or poetically, or some fancy title or name given by a couple of no names and those forgotten in a few generations. These tools belong to Death.

As such these sickles possess a power that makes them quite formidable, able to bypass exoteric protections such as fate that would prevent these blades from claiming their prey, multiple forms of immortality and even able to neutralize special forms of healing such as magic leaving a target with only normal healing to work with. Not even hiding will do them any good as these tools can track targets but only one at a time. On the bright side for them these wounds will not be infected as the lingering powers of death leaves the wounds clean of plague and pests.  
However; there is another more frightening power to these tools. The closer a target has been to death and how assured in their own invincibility the more powerful these tools and you become. With sickle in hand you can make even the mightiest of heroes turn tail and run, almost as if Death itself was hunting them.

While the boost is centred around how close the target has been to death it does gain minor boosts based on the target, how confident in their own invincibility, their fear for their mortality and how their being and actions pervert the natural course of things.  
In the garden of life you are the gardener, ready to prune the trees and cut the excess to ensure a healthy garden. Although there is another in the garden who tends to whistle, nothing to worry about as it's merely an old friend.​

The Necronomicon (Cthulhu Mythos)  
Cost: 20 SP  
You are the possessor of an alternate dimensional grimoire known as the True Necronomicon, a sentient and boundless tome of occult knowledge. With its pages continually expanding, it serves as a repository for an ever-growing wealth of esoteric wisdom. Unlike the limited version of its copies, this book grants you the ability to inscribe new laws into the fabric of reality. The intricate rituals within invoke the power of the Eldritch, enabling you to shape and redefine the very nature of the world you inhabit.  
While the True Necronomicon's form and size can adapt to suit your needs, it typically manifests as a weighty tome. Although the Necronomicon lacks an index or search feature, its sentience compensates for this limitation. Its inherent understanding of your intentions ensures that you are directed to the precise information you desire or need at any given moment. It also possesses a passive perception filter that protects readers from descending into complete insanity while delving into its unfathomable depths. It's worth noting, however, that this filter applies universally, and the book contains the works of myriad authors in an array of languages, including many that are non-human.  
Through highlighting certain words, the Necronomicon can communicate directly with you, ensuring that you always find the relevant knowledge or guidance you require. This unique communication method enhances your interaction with the tome, enabling a more seamless and efficient exploration of its boundless contents.  
Should you desire, the True Necronomicon can assimilate other spellbooks, tomes of lore, and occult knowledge, incorporating their contents into its ever-expanding compendium.  
*The Lovebound Grimoire*  
Required:Sucker For Love  
With your grasp, the Necronomicon has transformed into the Lovebound Grimoire, an otherworldly tome brimming with forbidden knowledge and secrets with the purpose of guiding you to summon and date eldritch gods. Its boundless pages now hold tips, guidance, and knowledge on how to best establish relationships with these enigmatic beings.  
(Note: The Lovebound Grimoire retains all previous functions and knowledge from the Necronomicon, this just updates its contents)

Graviton Beam Emitter (Blame\!)  
Cost: 15 SP  
The Graviton Beam Emitter (GBE) takes the form of an ordinary handgun, distinguished by a cross-shaped energy indicator at the gun's rear.  
Upon activation, the GBE emits a broad, perfectly cylindrical red beam capable of obliterating almost anything in its trajectory. While it hints at gravity-manipulation technology, the intricacies of its functioning have been lost to time, rendering reverse engineering impossible.  
The GBE fires condensed unknown energy, with the beam emitted literally pushing away the atoms of whatever is in its path; the pushed atoms crashing back together cause large explosions, creating additional damage than the initial gravity beam.  
It can be discharged in two modes: either by individually pulling the trigger for rapid shots or by holding the trigger longer to generate a charged shot with a larger, extended energy beam.  
\- Level 1 requires almost no charge and can be fired rapidly. At this level, the range of the weapon is 70 km.  
\- Level 2 requires several seconds of charge and is notably more powerful, creating massive holes in its target. If you can fire the gun on level 1 with minimum recoil, you are knocked backwards from the force of the kickback.  
\- Level 4, the weapon will actually open up. In this state the recoil is so powerful and instantaneous that it will actually tear off the limb holding it.  
Due to its substantial recoil, firing it beyond level 1 is ill-advised for regular humans, with a level 5 strongly discouraged even for an Endbringer.  
(Tsutomu Nihei has stated that the effects of the weapon are so powerful that if it were to ever be fired at its strongest from Earth's surface, it would have devastating effects on the climate and atmosphere of the planet itself.)

Ascalon/The Sword of Azmuth (Ben 10\)  
Cost: 40 SP  
Ascalon was conceived by Azmuth in his pursuit to harness the fundamental forces of the universe, with the intent to "cleave right through" and reshape reality. The First Thinker succeeded in his ambitions, forging a weapon of immense, incomprehensible power. With each strike, Ascalon rends apart the fabric of space and time, bending the laws of existence to the wielder's desires, reshaping the world as they see fit.  
As the chosen wielder of Ascalon, you are bestowed with its phenomenal cosmic power. Acknowledged as its sole master, Ascalon will bar others from wielding it. By invoking its essence, you can channel vast amounts of energy, empowering yourself and even reversing the weathering of age, restoring you to your prime while unlocking its extraordinary capabilities.  
You can then, at will, summon an all-encompassing armor of your choosing, unrestricted by the appearance depicted in the series. However, this is purely aesthetic and provides no tangible improvements or drawbacks beyond the inherent properties the armor already provides.  
Once summoned, the armor, in whatever form it may take, grants you the power to command and absorb energy, transforming it into a deadly weapon or an unyielding shield, depending on the situation. From your hands, you can unleash radiant waves or searing beams of pure energy, sweeping across the battlefield with devastating results, or conjure immense, shimmering domes to repel even the most brutal onslaughts. This mastery over energy affords you a graceful offense and an impenetrable defense, making you a force few can withstand.

The armor, on its own, provides with you incredible protection from threats, both physical and immaterial, while eliminating the original's susceptibility to electricity—be it from the ferocious onslaught of an Ultimate Vaxasaurian, searing blasts of pure mana, or even the effect of mind control, it stands unmoved. However, do not take this as invincibility—a sufficiently powerful attack may still overwhelm your defenses. Nevertheless, despite its might, the armor ultimately pales in comparison to the unmatched durability and offensive prowess of the blade itself.

Ascalon, the sword itself, holds all the powers and abilities of the armor, only amplified to astonishing levels. Its exceptional durability enables it to endure the cataclysmic destruction of an entire planet while its energy slashes eclipse the blasts unleashed from your armor. Yet, these abilities are merely just the beginning. Ascalon can slice through any material and even the fabric of reality, allowing you to create portals to any destination with a single, deft slash, rewrite, or reverse localized reality. When fully empowered, it can even alter or control fundamental aspects of the universe, including the annihilation of all evil.

Drach’nyen: The Echo of the First Murder (Warhammer 40K)  
Cost: 30 SP  
Drach’nyen is a powerful daemonic warp predator that has been known by many names in the history of humankind, such as The End of Empires and The Echo of the First Murder. This aetheric monster of humanity's sins now takes the form of a massive, two-handed sword, though in truth, it could take the form of any weapon its wielder desires. Born at the moment of the first murder, the first time a human killed another outside of the need to survive.

The name Drach’nyen is an approximation of the scream of the first murderer and that of the brother he murdered. That single act of evil planted a seed in the Immaterium, which would blossom into the daemon Drach’nyen, for every life taken by a human anywhere, every word of hatred spoken into the ears of the dying and dead, every thought of willingly murdering another to further one's own goals, makes this daemonic sword stronger.  
Upon its blade can be seen the faces of every murderer humanity has ever produced, bubbling to the surface with a silent scream before disappearing beneath the surface of the blade again. The sword is powerful enough to rend reality apart where it strikes, destroying anything and everything in its path without so much as any resistance.  
Drach'nyen also acts as a powerful passive psychic attack upon all one's foes in a large area around the wielder, attacking their minds with psychic torment, images, sounds, smells, pain, fear, and feelings of their own acts of murder, now turned back upon themselves. This has no effect on those who are entirely innocent of the crime of murder. Furthermore, the daemon animating the sword can greatly empower its chosen wielder with unnatural strength and fortitude. Having devoured and gorged itself on the blood of the Emperor of Mankind, its strength is far from finished developing.

Drach’nyen would normally extract a heavy toll on anyone wielding it, eating away at their sanity and morality; however, you are singularly immune to this; it’s voice has no effect on you outside of what a voice from a daemonic sword could normally convince you to do, hopefully very little, even being able to shut out its voice entirely should you choose so. It cannot communicate with or influence anyone else outside of you. Furthermore, should someone other than you try to use it, they will find the sword will fall through their hand as though it were made of air, though not before rending apart the offending limb with violent warp energy.  
*The Origin of Murder*  
Required:Original Vampire (World of Darkness \- Vampire: The Masquerade)  
Though Cain you might not precisely be. His sins you have, nevertheless, taken upon yourself. As the one responsible for the concept of murder being created Drach’nyen is especially taken with you. You have its complete and total loyalty. And furthermore your mere presence has unlocked it’s latent potential. Drach’nyen in your hands has the ability to deal death to anything as long as a single attack hits. It needs not be a sure hit, even a single nick is enough to kill. The blade merely needs to bite the least bit into something which you want dead, and it will be so.  
Furthermore the blade enhances your vampiric abilities, drinking blood for you, as every being with vitae you slay will instantly have all its sweet succulent life juices transferred to you upon their demise.

## Other Power Chars

### Physical

Jötunn  
Cost: 25 SP  
You are a Jötunn, a being descended from Ymir, the First Giant. Compared to the Gods, you are more an aspect of nature manifested—a part of the True Wild rather than civilization.  
This does not mean you are incapable of being civilized, however, as many Jötunn and Gods have intermarried throughout history.  
Jötunn are beings of immense power and magic, most often but not always distinguished by their towering size, standing several heads taller than a human, and often wielding the destructive forces of nature. For instance, you can hurl boulders weighing several hundred tons, sprint at speeds of several hundred meters per second, or recover from fatal wounds in mere days.  
They appear in many forms, from a stunning 10-meter-tall woman, a monstrous creature with ten heads, or even in the shape of animals. As a Jötunn, you can freely choose your form, as long as it exudes a supernatural aura—whether as a massive human or an animal with hair, beard, or fur made of leaves, or anything else that strikes your fancy.  
You obtain immense physical and magical might. Many Jötunn are deeply connected to the elements and the world around them, granting them exceptional affinities for specific magical arts or physical prowess that surpasses their peers.  
However, you are not restricted to your chosen affinity. Many Jötunn become master craftsmen, skilled weavers, fearsome warriors, or insightful seers capable of foreseeing the future and delivering prophecies far beyond their initial talents.  
You can also uncover the hidden paths to the mysterious realms of the Jötunn—secret ways concealed in the mountains, the twilight horizon, or even the flickering flames of a fire.  
*Dwarf*  
Required:The Craftsman  
You now also possess the powers inherited from the other children of Ymir—the Dwarves. This greatly enhances your affinity for crafting, extending it to encompass nearly all forms of creative works.  
Whether it is in blacksmithing, where you can forge weapons on par with Mjölnir or the fetters that bound Fenrir; weaving, where you can craft cloaks of invisibility that hide you from the senses of mortals; or brewing, where you can create meads capable of granting divine inspiration from blood and much more—you excel in all of these arts.  
You achieve this by using esoteric and conceptual ingredients such as the roots of a mountain, the sound of the wind, honor, or anything else your imagination can conceive.  
*Child of Loki*  
Required: Blood of the Gods, or Demigod (Percy Jackson)  
You are akin to the other children of Loki, granting you the potential for limitless growth in power, such that, over time, you can rival even the mightiest of the gods. You need only look to your siblings for inspiration.  
Fenrir, who grows endlessly and was chained by the gods out of fear; Jörmungandr, the World Serpent, whose size allows him to encircle Midgard and whose venom is capable of slaying even the strongest; or Hel, ruler of the Underworld, who holds dominion over all souls not claimed by Odin or Freya for their halls.  
This heritage accelerates your journey towards godhood, with your previously chosen abilities and affinities evolving over time. They will eventually become tied to your domain and take on a conceptual nature, further cementing your divinity.  
*Útgarða-Loki*  
Required: The Mist (Percy Jackson), or Illusion Magic  
You are now a Magician and Illusionist with the same level of skill as Útgarða-Loki. This grants you the ability to create illusions capable of even deceiving Gods and enchanting the World, giving form to the formless.  
With this power, you can ensure that whenever someone attempts to strike you, they hit nothing but the ground, oblivious to the fact that you haven’t even moved. You can shape the land to appear as a grand castle filled with actual food that can be eaten and much more.  
Your mastery of enchantment extends far beyond simple illusions. Drawing inspiration from the legendary deeds of Útgarða-Loki, you can shape wildfire into a man with an insatiable appetite, transform thought into a being with the speed of the mind, embody old age as an undefeatable old woman, link the World Serpent to a cat to make it immovable, or create an "endless" drinking horn connected to the ocean.  
Father of the World  
Cost: 30 SP  
Required:Jötunn  
You are now akin to Ymir, a primordial being born from the Gap before the World. Your power and exalted nature are such that, if you were somehow killed, your very flesh could be shaped into a new Universe, with your body serving as the foundation for a new generation of Gods and Giants.  
Yet, even while alive, you possess the ability to create and manipulate the phenomena of the World. You wield power and authority over all natural things, such as water, wind, earth, fire, metals, jewels, and trees, to name a few.  
If you so desire, you can recreate the primordial realms of Niflheim and Muspelheim, drawing upon their essence to shape new worlds or even beings equal to yourself. However, such a feat would require centuries of effort, even for one as powerful as you.  
*Texture of Scandinavia*  
Required: Divine Spirit (Type-Moon), or Incarnated God (Type-Moon)  
Your existence as a Primordial Jötunn has fused with your other half as a Divine God. This conceptual union grants you access to the Norse Texture of the World—a realm destroyed centuries ago by Surtr during Ragnarök.  
This connection allows you to gradually recreate the Texture, along with all the beings and magic it once contained, thanks to your life-giving properties. Over time, you will not only gain the Authorities of the Norse gods but also those of the Jötunn, including Surtr’s sword Laevatein and Fenrir’s Authority over Ice.  
You can choose to "deploy" and project the Texture onto the current world, replacing its existing reality with your own, thereby destroying what is presently there. Alternatively, if you wish to avoid destruction, you can take the slower path of integrating the existing world into your Texture, gradually taking control of it.  
Should you choose to deploy the Texture, the location where you do so becomes your "Throne". This Throne can take any form you desire, but if it is destroyed before the world’s destruction or integration, you will suffer immense backlash, with death being a possibility.  
With time, you may truly become Ymir reborn and reign as the Sovereign you were always destined to be.  
*Texture of Kemet*  
Required: Divine Spirit (Type-Moon), or Incarnated God (Type-Moon)  
Required:Egyptian Deity (Gods of Egypt)  
Through your divine blood and source of power, your Akh, or soul, is now intrinsically tied to Egypt—or Kemet, as it was known in antiquity. As a being capable of existing within the Darkness and the Primeval Ocean, you hold the power to Name and bring forth the Texture of Kemet from nothingness once more.  
This power enables you to slowly Name all things within the Texture, restoring them to the World. As you do so, you will gain the ability to summon and control the beings within it, such as the Sphinx, which wards off spirits; the Bennu, which carries the soul for rebirth; and Ammit, the devourer of souls, among many others.  
By Naming and recreating even the gods themselves, you become the All-Father of Kemet, inheriting their Authorities to shape the World as you see fit. You can assume their divine and animal forms, cementing your right to rule—a right that can neither be denied nor overturned, ensuring your eternal reign.  
You can choose to "deploy" and project the Texture onto the current world, replacing its existing reality with your own, thereby destroying what is presently there. Alternatively, if you wish to avoid destruction, you can take the slower path of integrating the existing world into your Texture, gradually taking control of it.  
Should you choose to deploy the Texture, the location where you do so becomes your "Throne". This Throne can take any form you desire, but if it is destroyed before the world’s destruction or integration, you will suffer immense backlash, with death being a possibility.  
*Texture of Mesopotamia*  
Required: Divine Spirit (Type-Moon), or Incarnated God (Type-Moon)  
Required:Bull of Heaven (Type-Moon)  
You now hold a Tie of En to the Texture of the Mesopotamian Gods through your ownership of the Great Bull of Heaven, Gugalanna. As the World Father, this connection grants you the power to recreate this Texture and all that exists within it.  
Over time, you may slowly summon the various divine beasts of Mesopotamia, such as Anzu, the fire- and water-breathing bird, or Mushussu, the dragon-serpent that protects cities and enables travel between realms.  
As you progress in the rebirth of the Texture, you will gradually lay claim to the Authorities of the gods and their Divine Armaments. For example, you may wield Ereshkigal's power to control the Underworld and bind even the gods who enter, or command the Axe of Marduk, a weapon that is the size of a building.  
With Gugalanna, you have a choice: you may take his power, authority, and divine bull form for yourself, or allow him to remain a separate entity in your service.  
You can choose to "deploy" and project the Texture onto the current world, replacing its existing reality with your own, thereby destroying what is presently there. Alternatively, if you wish to avoid destruction, you can take the slower path of integrating the existing world into your Texture, gradually taking control of it.  
Should you choose to deploy the Texture, the location where you do so becomes your "Throne". This Throne can take any form you desire, but if it is destroyed before the world’s destruction or integration, you will suffer immense backlash, with death being a possibility.  
*Pangu, Divider of Heaven & Earth*  
Required: Divine Spirit (Type-Moon), or Incarnated God (Type-Moon)  
Required:Philosophy Foundation (Type-Moon)  
You, who share a connection to the Tiānxià Texture, now ascend to the mantle of the Primordial Giant Pangu, a being of your same exalted nature. This bond significantly enhances your abilities and accelerates your capacity to reforge the Tiānxià Texture. As Pangu’s inheritor, you embody his divine potential, standing as a cosmic force poised to shape the world.  
However, like Pangu himself, you are bound by the necessity of growth. Though your power is heightened, it will take centuries of development before you achieve the true might required to part Heaven and Earth as Pangu once did. Until you reach this zenith, your strength remains immense yet incomplete, a promise of the unparalleled divinity that lies ahead.

Most crucially, you have inherited Pangu's Nameless Axe, the Heaven Splitting Axe that defined his legend. This mythical weapon, imbued with the essence of cosmic separation, is an equal to Ea, the Sword of Rupture of Mesopotamian myth. The axe's power is unparalleled, capable of splitting dimensions, cleaving through the fabric of reality, and bringing forth order from primordial chaos. Its existence marks you as a shaper of worlds, a being of supreme consequence in the cosmic hierarchy.  
As Pangu's mantle-bearer, you are destined to walk the path of a creator and divider, balancing growth with the weight of a giant’s responsibility. Your bond with the Tiānxià Texture and mastery of the Heaven Splitting Axe mark the first steps of your journey to rival the deeds of the Primordial Giant himself.

Bastet

Required:Nekomata  
Your spiritual and fairy natures have come together and expanded beyond what either would ever hope to become alone. You have awakened, within you, an Eye of Ra, granting you the full creative power of the sun goddess you are destined to embody.

Any life that is brought to bear in this way is guaranteed to be born with perfect health, devoid of any illness, genetic, random, or otherwise. Any that carry your life are guaranteed to undergo the process without issue or harm, and will experience it at an expedited rate.  
As a master of life, you are not obligated to share your grace with others, and can even rescind your gift with a mere touch. A touch is all you need to claim the life-force of anyone you please in any quantity. As an extension of your fey and spiritual abilities, you can fully manipulate the souls within others, push, pull, or twist them into whatever configuration suits your needs. The amount of ghostly fire you can conjure is now able to match the output of the sun itself. Your presence can evoke a great sense of peace and can fully soothe the wrathful. Pushing your divine presence enforces serenity upon your surroundings, negating aggressive drives in those around you.  
*Through the Eyes of the Sun*  
Required:Sekhmet  
The joining of your two halves has seen your light grow beyond bounds. You now claim the entirety of the sun’s light as your and any light on earth as your divine eyes. Every photon, from the dimmest embers of a dying flame to the lonely spark traveling the expanse of the cosmos, is an extension of yourself.  
Merging with your martial half has brought a whole host of empowerment and blessings you may confer to those that bask in your peaceful rays. A mere spark of your divine grace is enough to send any of your blessed beyond their limits. However, be careful not to overcharge your followers too much, for only the most resolute will be able to handle the full weight of your light.

Sekhmet  
Cost: 35 SP  
Required:Cheetah  
Required:Leopard  
Your mastery over your body has reached its limit and refused to stop. Igniting the power of your soul has incinerated the limits that once held you back. You have taken more than a step, or even a leap and a bound, forward into the realm of gods. As the fire within you stabilizes and fills you with its warmth, you open an Eye of Ra, granting you the vengeful power and heat of the sun befitting the warrior goddess that beckons your destiny.  
With a mere breath, you can bring forth the fiery might of the sun to bear against your enemies. The heat at your control can burn away and banish the very notion of evil, destroying its vessels and warding against its return. Should you wish it, you can bring your heat against the world itself, giving rise to massive deserts.  
Those that bask in your heat will find disease and other ailments fail to progress, allowing them to recover at expedited rates. So long as your heat remains, those in your heat will continue to enjoy an absence of disease in any form. In the unlikely event you shall find yourself defeated, you need only wait no longer than a day as you find yourself fully renewed upon the dawn of a new day. Yet, before you get to that point, you can turn your flames upon yourself and burn away the concept of your injuries to reforge yourself into peak condition.

While your power is a vengeful one, you still hold a mastery over it, and thus can freely choose how your fire and heat interact with the world around you. You can blast an entire nation into a desert of glass without touching a single hair on the head of any of its citizens. You can imbue the concept of your heat into objects and foods, giving birth to potent weapons capable of defeating evil, and creating medicines and tonics capable of burning away what ails a person. Your martial might is enough to stand against the whole of humanity and bring them to their end should another god not come to distract you.  
Taking the visage of a lion, your presence can evoke a great sense to act and work towards one’s ambitions. Pushing the weight and authority of your presence, the ferocity of your royal visage can bring the most boisterous and arrogant to heel.  
*Heralded by the Morning Star*  
Required:Bastet  
The merging of your two halves has seen a great expansion to what you claim as your purview. You are intimately aware of everything within your light and fully capable of processing that information to whatever amount you wish. You don’t need precognition because the rate at which you gather information is instantaneous, but like any other limit, that won’t stop you. The flow of information within your light flows faster for you than anyone else, granting you your own form of precognition as you learn what happens before causality makes it so.
